characters: A GUARD PUNCHES HIS PASSCODE INTO THE VAULT KEYPAD. 174
THE TANKER TRUCK CRASHES INTO THE BACK OF THE CATERING
THE DECLARATION OF INDEPENDENCE IS GONE
THE GUARDS PUSH OPEN THE VAULT DOOR... 175
...HE DROPS THE DECLARATION OF INDEPENDENCE INTO THE WATE
GOD'S EYE VIEW OF PENNSYLVANIA AVENUE. EVENING. 90
EACH CAR IN FRONT OF THE CATERING TRUCK PLOWS INTO THE CA
STOMPING ON THEM WITH HIS SHOE. ..CRUNCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wet cobblestones are beaten by a_ heavy rain. A CARRIAGE WHEEL splashes through huge puddles.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: It was 1832...

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The carriage races through the darkened streets. A flash of lightning illuminates the coachman. It's a drenched boy, THOMAS GATES.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: ...Thomas Gates was ten years old. Thomas whips the wild-eyed horse and turns a sharp corner

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Riding inside is CHARLES CARROLL. He's 96 years old. His weak body wracks with coughs, death closing in.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Mr. Charles Carroll, the last surviving signer of the Declaration of Independence had asked Thomas to take him to see President Andrew Jackson. He said it was urgent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gbrough the White House windows, we can_see finely dresse GENTLEMEN and WOMEN partying, old-school. Thomas pulls th carriage to a stop, jumps down, and sprints to a DOORMAN.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: The President must come quickly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas opens the carriage door, but Carroll sits motionle

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Mr. Carroll? Carroll peeks open an eye, coughs weakly.

dialogues.speaker: CARROLL
dialogues.text: (off Thomas' look) He's not coming, is he?  National Treasure, 4/9/03

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: They told me he was busy.

dialogues.speaker: CARROLL
dialogues.text: But the treasure! The treasure! Carroll breaks into a fit of coughs. Thomas looks down an sees that Carroll's handkerchief is stained with blood.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: We should've gone to see the doctor. Carroll suddenly pulls the boy close.

dialogues.speaker: CARROLL
dialogues.text: Listen now, or the secret dies with me! Carroll stares at Thomas, dead serious. Carroll's face is ashen. A desperate look in his eyes. Thomas listens.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: That night, Mr. Carroll told Thomas about a great treasure, the greatest treasure of them all...

dialogues.speaker: FLASH TO
dialogues.text: A PYRAMID, EGYPT 2000 B.C. NIGHT. The surrounding city is on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrying torches, SLAVES bust down a stone wall, revealin a DARK ROOM. A Slave holds up his torch to see... A ROOM MADE OF SOLID GOLD, filled with items made of gold and precious stones.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: ...a treasure amassed throughout all time... As_the slaves loot the Pharaoh's tomb, we PUSH IN on the golden tomb walls which are decorated with MASONIC SYMBOL the ALL-SEEING EYE and the UNFINISHED PYRAMID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROMAN SOLDIERS carry treasure out of the burning Temple o Solomon. We recognize the treasure as the same treasure from Egypt, only now it includes more... COPPER SCROLLS. A GOLD MENORAH. A GOLD BAS RELIEF.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: ...a treasure amassed over all continents... 6  10 11 12 13 National Treasure, 4/9/03 3.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As the soldiers cart out the treasure, we see the same Masonic symbols on the temple columns, then CUT TO... A TREMENDOUS POUNDING. CLOSE ON men's hands wearing 9 armored gloves. They draw straws. One hand pulls the SHORT STRAW. We WIDEN to reveal we're in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of KNIGHTS wearing Masonic insignia on their armo look to their brother with the short straw. The POUNDING INTENSIFIES. SOLDIERS are banging down the church doors.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: ...a_treasure the Knights of the Templar found and swore to protect... The Knight with the short straw surrenders his armor, don a MONK'S ROBE, and slips out just as SOLDIERS burst throu the church doors. The outnumbered KNIGHTS fight bravely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The knight who got away leads a small caravan through the forest. In the carriages, hidden under tarps...the TREASU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KING PHILIP OF FRANCE watches emotionless as the Knights who didn't escape are BURNED AT THE STAKE.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: ...even when faced with death. For the Knights believed that a treasure so great was not meant for any one man, king or not. The knights' screams are drowned out by the sound of the ocean as we CUT TO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ship laden with the treasure crosses the stormy sea. Th ship's name...the SANTA MARIA.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: ...The Templar Knights who escaped execution took the treasure to the New World... At the ship's helm is CHRISTOPHER COLUMBUS. We PUSH IN on a medallion hanging around his neck. On it, the PYRAMID and ALL-SEEING EYE.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...The Knights were fugitives and developed secret passwords and signs of their order...  13 14 15 16 17 18 National Treasure, 4/9/03 4.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We KEEP PUSHING IN on the medallion until the PYRAMID fil the screen. We then transition to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AZTECS hurriedly unload the TREASURE from the pyramid as Hernando Cortes and his army attack the city.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: ...The treasure survived many more wars and was moved many times...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrying a lantern, a MAN wearing a tricorn hat closes th stone door on the treasure. The man is COUNT CASIMIR PULASKI, general of the Continental Army.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: ...Some believe it was buried in Nova Scotia, but Mr. Carroll told Thomas the treasure had been hidden by the Freemasons, the descendants of the Templar Knights. These descendants included such men as Patrick Henry, Benjamin Franklin, George Washington...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rallying his troops against the Red Coats, PULASKI takes musket ball in the chest and falls from his horse.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: ...and other soldiers who fought bravely for the Continental Army during the Revolutionary War. len like Count Casimir Pulaski who died in the Siege of Savannah... CUT TO LATER. SOLDIERS comb through the battlefield 17 carnage. They find Pulaski's dead body and roll him over. On his finger, we _now see he's wearing a silver ring bearing the ALL-SEEING EYE and PYRAMI symbols.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: ...and took the secret to the whereabouts of the treasure to his grave... The soldiers search Pulaski but find only a piece of pape with one word written on it: "CHARLOTTE."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With his last breath of life...  18 19 National Treasure, 4/9/03 5.

dialogues.speaker: CARROLL
dialogues.text: ...The secret lies with Charlotte. Find her, and you will find the treasure. Tell the President. Tell no one else. With that, Carroll dies. We now notice that Carroll is also wearing a MASONIC RING. Suddenly, the carriage door opens to reveal PRESIDENT AND JACKSON, a_tall man with flowing grey hair. He looks to Mr. Carroll, but he's...too late.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT JACKSON
dialogues.text: Poor old fool. Coming all the way here in the pouring rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: President Jackson starts back. Thomas hurries after him.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Wait! Mr. Carroll wanted me to tell you something.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT JACKSON
dialogues.text: If this is about that damned treasure--

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: --You know of it?

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT JACKSON
dialogues.text: He's spoken of it no less than a hundred times.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: He said Charlotte has it.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT JACKSON
dialogues.text: We've been looking for Charlotte for years. She doesn't exist. The president stops and looks at Thomas.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT JACKSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who are you, young man?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Thomas Gates.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT JACKSON
dialogues.text: Well, you'd best forget anything Mr. Carroll told you. The treasure is a legend. Nothing more. With that, President Jackson turns back to the White Hous We PUSH IN ON Thomas' face, watching the President go.  19 20 National Treasure, 4/9/03

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Well, Thomas never forgot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELDERLY FOLKS watch current President Ronald Reagan on T. while JOHN ADAMS GATES (78) finishes _regaling his wide-e 10-year-old grandson BEN FRANKLIN GATES with his tale. (W realize now that the MAN'S VOICE belongs to John.)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Thomas looked for Charlotte... John Gates' face reflects a long life spent chal engang t elements. He turns a page in a tattered OLD SCRAPBOOK. CLOSE ON a black and white photo. A grown-up Thomas Gates stands at a excavation site, Aztec ruins in the backgroun The caption: "Thomas Gates, Teotihuacan, Mexico 1856"

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ...AS did his son, George Washington Gates... John turns the page to another photo of another GATES. Al the Gates men bear a strong family resemblance.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...Generation after generation, our ancestors have tried to find Charlotte and failed.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Maybe Charlotte is an anagram. You know, you rearrange the letters, and it means something else. John stops. He's never thought of that before.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Like "hotel crate."

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: That's too many e's. It'd have to be the "hotel cart," or "tear cloth" or "teal torch" or "Rachel Ott." Ben quickly rattles off the anagrams. John is impressed.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Maybe you'll be the one who finally finds her.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: How will I know it's the right Charlotte when I do? 19 20  20 National Treasure, 4/9/03 7.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: John pulls out a $1-bill and presses it on his T.V. tray.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Because she'll be marked with these. CLOSE ON the $1-bill. John's craggy finger points to the UNFINISHED PYRAMID and ALL-SEEING E on the back.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The unfinished pyramid and the all- seeing eye. The marks of the Knights of the Templar. Ben studies the dollar-bill with newfound curious awe.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Our founding fathers, the Freemasons, designed our nation's Great Seal and left us all the clues. These symbols are telling us something. I’ just don't know what.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Don't worry, grandpa. I'll figure it out, and I’1ll find her. TI swear.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You swear what? They turn to find Ben's father PATRICK HENRY GATES (40s). Patrick looks just like his father, albeit decades younge

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: That I'll find Charlotte. Patrick shoots a baleful look to his dad.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Dammit, dad. How many times have I told you? Ben's not going to waste his time chasing a treasure that doesn't exist.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: He's a Gates. It's in his blood. Ben's gonna look for it, just like you did and I did.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: He's smarter than us. Ben's going to Harvard. He's going to be a lawyer or a_doctor. Right, Ben? Ben looks to his dad, then to his grandpa, then back to h dad as we DISSOLVE TO...WHITE. All we can hear is... BEEP...BEEP...BEEP. A heart monitor? The beeping fades.  20 21 22 23 National Treasure, 4/9/03 8.

dialogues.speaker: GROWN-UP BEN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: We're losing her... We WIDEN to reveal we're in...

dialogues.speaker: DAY 21
dialogues.text: Dressed in heavy arctic gear, intrepid explorer BEN GATES (late 20s, strong family resemblance) monitors a laptop. ON THE SCREEN, red and blue dots signif ing amplitudes ma random patterns on a subsurface trace of BEEPING GPR puls

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: ...Go left. The driver, RILEY POOLE (25, unkempt), cranks the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SNOWCAT (The Endeavor) trundles left, its tractor tre clawing through the ice. The Endeavor also has giant scre shaped pontoons to propel over water.

dialogues.speaker: DAY 23
dialogues.text: Riley wipes the frost from the window.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Maybe she's not here.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: She's here.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: We've been looking for weeks. You're going on data that's 200 years old.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: 200-year-old data is usually the kind of data you go on when you're looking for something that's been lost for 200 years.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Sailors have a way of exaggerating you know. What if the storm wasn't as big as they said it was? We could be hundreds of miles off. Ben scans the landscape ahead where the ice ends in a SHE GLACIAL CLIFF.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: The Inuits said they could still see the masts poking up through the ice just three generations ago.  23 24 25 26 National Treasure, 4/9/03 9.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Were they smoking anything at the time?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Only for medicinal purposes. Just then, the GPR BLEEPS loudly. They both look to... THE COMPUTER SCREEN. We now see that the red and blue dot have taken an unmistakable shape...A BLOB WITH SPLATTERS. Ben and Riley exchange a look. Hopeful but wary.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Could be a frozen whale. CUT TO AN ICE AX. It swings hard, shattering the ice, 24 revealing a WOMAN'S FROZEN FACE. We PULL BACK to reveal..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben chips away the ice. AS THE ICE is chipped away, we se the face is CARVED OUT OF WOOD.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Isn't she beautiful? Ben grins. When Riley sees the face, he is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I'll radio base camp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding a pote (used for measuring snow depth) Ben and Ri watch as three SNOWMOBILES approach and pull to stops.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I'd hate to be you right now. A lot of people relying on you. A lot of money riding on this.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I'd hate_to be you right now. All that cholesterol and hair where it's not supposed to be. A man wearing expensive high-tech gear hops out of a snow This is IAN HOWE (40s, British). A rich adventurer.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Gates! Where is she? Ben gestures to the figurehead in the snow. When Ian sees the woman's face, he grins like a kid on Christmas mornin  National Treasure, 4/9/03 10.

dialogues.speaker: IAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bloody hell, you found it. You really found it! You're a genius!

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I told you if you underwrote this expedition, you wouldn't be sorry.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: (calls to his crew) Shaw! Get the champagne. Ian drops to_his knees and studies the figurehead's face, almost disbelieving.

dialogues.speaker: IAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know how many expeditions I've financed that've turned up nothing?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Well now, we're all about to be rich, and it's a beautiful thing. without the champagne. A solidly built man (SHAW) approaches, | h o'd do anything for hire. Shaw is e type of man w

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Shaw? The champagne?

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: I thought we were looking for a 100-foot frigate.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: We were. She is.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Then how come GPR indicates this ship's only 81-feet long? Shaw hands Ben a GPR printout. Ben reads it.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Because this is a 2-dimensional | rendering of a 3-dimensional object. The image is only 81-feet long because the ship's canted.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Canted?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Tipped. Tilted. Lying at an angle.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: How canted?  26 27 28 29 National Treasure, 4/9/03 11.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: By our calculations, about 35°. Which means the stern's about 57 feet down.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: 57 feet down?! Christ! We'll be digging for a week.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: No, we won't. Ben slams the POLE DOWN INTO the ice, puncturing a small hole. WHOOSH of wind blows up on them. Ben shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Air pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Endeavor is now parked next to a newly bored hole int the ice. Shaw mans a winch while... Two more workers direct a steel cable which plays out fro the Endeavor's front end. These men are SHIPPEN intense, ex-Army, and POWELL, brawny, ex-con. We follow the steel cable down which disappears down into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daylight illuminates the cylindrical blue walls of this. narrow opening. Wearing a helmet and headlamp, Riley ride down on the cable which is lowering a heavy generator...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley joins Ben_and Ian who are staring at something we don't immediately see. We REVERSE to reveal... A nearly perfectly preserved SHIP, tipped 35°, its hull a stern frozen in a wall of this vast ice cave. The ship is wooden with three masts. Its ancient sails ar wrapped in its frozen casings. Icicles hang from frozen ropes. One of the ship's masts is broken. The other two tower up until they are swallowed by the cave's ice ceili They all stare at the ship in its ghostlike beauty.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: The frigate Charlotte. Last_seen leaving port from Maine in 1779.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Looks like she ran into some bad weather.  29 30 31 National Treasure, 4/9/03 12.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We FOLLOW Ben who trudges up the icy incline to the bow. With his glove, he wipes away the snow. Through a thick layer of ice, we can make out the ship's name..."CHARLOTTE."

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Hello, sweetheart. CUT TO ARC LIGHTS BEING LIT. We PULL BACK to reveal... 30

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cave is now illuminated by intense lights powered by enerators. A nylon rope ladder and cables dangle down rom the hole in the cave's ceiling. Shaw, Powell, and Shippen finish securing the ship with ropes and spikes while Ben, Riley, and Ian don climbing harnesses and snap ice crampons to their boots.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Riley, you take the berthing . quarters. Ian, check the Captain's cabin. I'll take the cargo hold.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: I'll take the cargo hold.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Suit yourself. Ian rises. Moves to the ship. Riley shoots Ben a look.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: You dog. You wanted the Captain's Cabin.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Hey, we're all just looking for the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Fine. Then, I want the Captain's Cabin.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Sure. Whatever you want. Riley studies Ben. Now completely mind-fucked.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: OK, forget it. You're trying to trick me, I know it. I got the berthing quarters. You take the crappy Captain's Cabin.  32 33 34 35 36 37 38 39 National Treasure, 4/9/03 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ian, Ben, and Riley move across the steeply angled deck. Each wears a helmet-lamp and carries a metal detector. Th old ship GROANS as the timbers shift under their weight. They cross the deck then move in different directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley ducks his head under frozen hammocks as he moves through the cramped crew's quarters. He sweeps his metal detector over the debris. lothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ian moves through the gun deck. The heavy iron cannons have all slid across the floor and lie piled at the stern

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben edges down a tilted staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley's headlamp light plays over the broken shelves, rop boxes, then stops on...THREE MEN'S HEADS. Riley lets out startled GASP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben overhears Riley gasp on his radio headset.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Riley...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warily, Riley comes around to find a trio of SEAMEN, bund in blankets, eerily frozen.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Uh-huh?

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (VIA MIC)
dialogues.text: Find something?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. INTERCUT Ben. By the sound of Riley's voice, he knows...

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Dead people?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY, (VIA MIC)
dialogues.text: (voice cracking) Uh-huh.  39 40 41 42 43 44 National Treasure, 4/9/03 14.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (laughs to himself) What'd you expect? You're in the berthing quarters. Ben wrenches open a closed door. Its frozen hinges SQUEAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben finds an old oil lantern and lights it with a lighter We then _see the Captain's Cabin. Plush furniture. An orn desk. Everything covered in a thin layer of ice. Ben moves to the desk and quickly rifles through it. He finds nothing of value except for an antique POCKET WATCH which he pockets. He then looks down and notices... DEEP SCRATCHES in the floor by the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ian gets a reading on his metal detector. He pushes aside some netting. Finds a TRUNK. He pries it open...DISHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben pushes the desk aside, revealing a TRAP DOOR undernea He pulls it open. Peers down to find a dark, hidden room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben jumps down, looks around. The room is crowded with large BARRELS. He pulls one of the plugs, and... BLACK GUNPOWDER spills out into a pile onto the icy floor Ben turns to go then notices... TwO BOOTS poking out from between a row of barrels. Ben moves to the row and finds... THE CAPTAIN. Frozen dead. Gun in his lap. Leaning up against one of the barrels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley enters to find Ben nowhere in sight.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Down here! He hurries to the trap door and peers down to see Ben struggling with the barrel of gunpowder.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: You found it!  45 46 National Treasure, 4/9/03 15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley jumps down into the room as Ben pries open the barr

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: There's gold in there. I can smell it. Excited, Riley watches as Ben lifts the lid to reveal...m gunpowder. But Riley is undaunted.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe it's in another barrel. But Ben sticks both arms into the barrel he opened.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: The Captain was guarding this barrel for a reason. As Ben roots around, gunpowder SPILLS ALL OVER THE FLOOR. After a beat, Ben finally stops. He's found something. He exchanges a Look with Rit ey, then pulls out a SMALL BOX. It's labeled "Little Hunting Creek, Virginia." Ben carefully opens it, revealing...AN IVORY PIPE.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Riley. Do you know what this is? Riley eyes it, disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I'm hoping a billion-dollar pipe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ian enters as Ben and Riley emerge from the trap door.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Ian! Look at this! Ben shows him the pipe. Ian glances at it, unimpressed.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: A Meerschaum pipe. 18th Century. I have three.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: This box_is marked Little Hunting Creek. That's what Mt. Vernon was called before George Washington's family renamed it.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: George Washington's pipe. And?  National Treasure, 4/9/03 16.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: And it's gonna lead us to the treasure.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Ben Ben Ben tip. Ben the the Ben "Lead us?" You said the treasure would be on Charlotte.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: No, I said "the secret lies with Charlotte." “This pipe has to be that secret. strains to make out something on the pipe.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There're markings on here. I need some ink.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: I didn't spend a quarter of a million dollars to find a pipe. finds a quill and a bottle of ink, but the ink is frozen.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Come on, Ian. This is a treasure hunt. You can't just find it in the first place you look.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: It only took me three weeks to find the Panamanian Galleon wreck with my last so-called expert. I've been funding you for six months.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Seven. takes the quill and suddenly stabs his finger with the Riley sees this and winces.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: What the hell're you doing? rubs his blood _on the pipe then rolls the pipe over. desktop, revealing...Al MPRINT IN BLOOD. le recognize symbols: THE ALL-SEEING EYE and UNFINISHED PYRAMID.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: The Templar symbols.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Does it say where the treasure is? reads from the bloody imprint on the desk.  National Treasure, 4/9/03 17.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: "The legend writ, the stain effected The key in Silence undetected Fifty-five in iron pen Mr. Matlack can't offend."

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I didn't hear the part about "X" marks the spot.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: What does it mean?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: It's a riddle. "Key" and "legend." It's referring to a map.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: What map?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: "Undetected" and "in silence" means the map is hidden.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Of course. A hidden map. Where? Ian picks up the pipe. Studies it.

dialogues.speaker: IAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "Iron pen" could mean iron manacles, iron bars...55 men in prison! Or no, wait. Perhaps 55 refers to the year 1755. Who's "Mr. Matlack"?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Timothy Matlack. The official scribe of the Continental Congress. (realizes) "Iron" because they used iron-based inks back then.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Scribe. A writer?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: No, a calligrapher. He transcribed documents for the Continental Congress.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: So, Mr. Matlack made a map. Where would he hide it?

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: "Mr. Matlack can't offend." Why can't he offend it?  National Treasure, 4/9/03 18.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: It means he didn't write over the map. It's probably on the back of something he transcribed.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: What'd he transcribe?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Lots of things. The most famous document being... His voice trails off.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Being what? The Constitution? The Bill of Rights?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: (relieved) Thank God.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: The Declaration of Independence. A beat of incredulity, then Riley scoffs...

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: There's no map on the back of the Declaration of Independence. Ben gives him a look, like yes there is.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There's a map on the back of the Declaration of Independence?!

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: It's brilliant if you think about it. Such an important document insured the map's survival.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Too bad we'll never see it.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Nonsense. We get a viewing.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Nobody gets a viewing. Not even the President.  National Treasure, 4/9/03 19.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ben laughs,

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: What kind of sick person would put a treasure map on the back of the Declaration of Independence?!

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Could've been a number of people. Nine of the signers of the Declara- tion of Independence were known to be Freemasons. Ben Franklin, Robert Treat Paine, John Hancock to name a few. Thomas Jefferson and John Adams were suspected members of the order. George Washington wasn't a signer, but he had access. He was a ist Master Mason. He was also a surveyor and map-maker before he was commander of the Continental Army. He's got my vote.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Well, there is one way to see the Declaration of Independence in person.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Really? How?

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: We "borrow" it. incredulous. Ian pockets the pipe.

dialogues.speaker: IAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on, Ben. The Lost Treasure of the Knights of the Templar is the treasure of all treasures. Gold- from the Temple of Solomon, King Alaric II's ransom of the Athenians, the entire wealth of 5th century Rome, the Sword of Alexander the Great. You've been looking for this treasure all your life. You're not going to let a piece of paper stand in your way, are you?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You can't be serious.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: What else are you going to do? Go back to working on salvage crews? Comb beaches with a metal detector looking for doubloons? Oh, that's right. You have your PhD in History. Maybe you can teach high school history.  National Treasure, 4/9/03 20.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Forget it, Ian. I won't steal the Declaration of Independence.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Don't get soft now. You begged me to finance_your expedition when everyone else thought you were crazy.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You financed this expedition because you knew this treasure would make you amous.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: And, it will.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I won't let you. IAN PULLS OUT HIS GUN from his belt. Trains it on Ben who is STUNNED.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Oh, you didn't bring one of these?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You're not going to shoot me, Ian. Not until you know all that t know about the riddle. Ian studies Ben. Is he bluffing?

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Such as?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Put the gun away. Ian turns his gun on Riley instead.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Tell me, or I shoot Riley.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Wait! How do you know I don't know something else about the riddle?! Ben and Ian can't help but just give Riley a look, then I pulls the trigger...BLAM! Riley flinches as the glass porthole in the wall just beh him shatters. The old ship GROANS.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit. Come on, Ben. Tell him what he doesn't know.  46 47 48 49 National Treasure, 4/9/03 21.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Okay... Ben comes up with HIS LIGHTER and flicks it on.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...for one thing, the whole room below us is full of gunpowder. Ben holds the flame over the trap door in the floor.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You shoot anyone, I drop this, and none of us gets out of here alive. Ian eyes the flame. Ben eyes the gun. A tense stand-off.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: (incredulous) Whoa-whoa-whoa! How did we all go from wildly rich to dead in a matter of minutes? Let's think here. Just then, the FLAME FLICKERS AND GOES OUT. Ian shrugs. On reflex, Ben tackles Riley and hurls them both to the ground behind the desk as... Ian OPENS fire on them...BLAM-BLAM-BLAM-BLAM-BLAM! Bullets CHEW UP the desk and walls. One bullet takes out the GAS LANTERN. It explodes with an OIL FIRE, instantly setting the desk ablaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ian hurries out of the cabin and battens the door shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flames spill down from the desk and creep across the floo Ben tries the cabin door. It's locked.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: We gotta put this fire out. Riley tries to smother the fire. It's hopeless. Ben grabs his ax and slams it into the door. Riley joins him. We PAN DOWN to the burning floor and PUSH through it into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BURNING EMBERS fall from the ceilin float to the floor, catching a POWDER trail spilled on fhe ground. It ignites and BURNS A PATH toward...the BARRELS OF GUNPOWDER.  50 51 52 53 54 55 National Treasure, 4/9/03 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ian hurries across the tilted deck, calling to his men...

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Get the hell out of here. It's gonna blow! Ian leaps off the deck, then runs with Shaw to the rope ladders.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: I heard gunshots.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Gates and Riley tried to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The burning trail of gunpowder reaches the first barrel, and the wood barrel CATCHES FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaw, Powell, and Shippen run like hell to their snowcats Ian is the last man out of the hole in the ice, and he PU UP _THE ROPE LADDERS. Shaw climbs into a snowcat.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Come on! Ian jumps in with Shaw, and they all take off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An inferno. Portholes SHATTER as their panes shift. Ben and Riley finally bust through the door and scramble out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BARREL OF GUNPOWDER burns, fully engulfed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Riley emerge from below and look across the way t find that THE ROPE LADDERS are gone! They're trapped.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: They pulled up the ladders. Riley regards his surroundings, resigned.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Why do I ever listen to you? I was two credits away from graduation.  55 56 57 58 59 60 61 62 National Treasure, 4/9/03 23.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: That was seven years ago. Ben spots a SWIVEL CROSS-BOW HARPOON mounted on the deck and hurries to it.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Intel offered me a job with my own cubicle. Ben ties a rope to a spear and loads it into the harpoon.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Do we have to go over this every expedition?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Until I get rich, yes. Ben wheels the harpoon around and aims it at Riley's head

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Fine. Now, duck! Ben releases_the harpoon...WHOOSH! The spear ROCKETS over a ducking Riley up to the CAVE's ceiling. THUNK! Ben grabs the ROPE. Pulls hard. The ice ceiling caves in, opening a hole just above the ship's bow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Riley clamber out of the ground just where the la figurehead pokes through the ice. They race to the Endeav INTERCUT: The barrel of GUNPOWDER. It BLOWS...KA-BOOM! 57 INTERCUT: The arctic landscape. The ground shakes 58 violently. Ben and Riley dive into THE ENDEAVOR just as.. INTERCUT: The other barrels BLOW in a chain-reaction 59 series of explosions. ..BOOM-BOOM-BOOM-BOOM-BOOM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FIREBALL ERUPTS from the snow and ice. The CONCUSSION launches THE ENDEAVOR forward off... THE GLACIAL CLIFF! The Endeavor plummets down to... 61

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Endeavor HITS THE WATER AND SINKS LIKE A ROCK as a FIREBALL rolls skyward in the background. Burning SHARDS of WOOD rain down onto the icy waters. A long beat, then...  62 63 64 65 National Treasure, 4/9/03 24.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WHOOSH! The Endeavor POPS BACK UP, floating on its pontoo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley laughs, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: It drives! It flies! It floats! (looks around) It needs a toilet. Ben looks at the smoke and fire, solemn.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Ian's going to steal it.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Why do you always have to focus on the negative? You found Charlotte. That was your life's quest. Be

dialogues.speaker: I
dialogues.text: happy . m the one who should be upset. I'm not wildly rich, which is my life's quest.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Riley, it's the Declaration of Independence.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Do you see an American flag planted in my ass?_ I didn't _even vote in the last election. I'm in this for the money.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Well, if Ian gets the Declaration of Independence, he gets the treasure. All of it. Riley considers that a beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Suddenly I'm feeling very patriotic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The famous green thoroughfare. There's the Lincoln Monume the Washington Monument, the White House. We TRAVEL down Pennsylvania Avenue, finally coming to... THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES. A beautiful neoclassical building. CLOSE ON THE DECLARATION OF INDEPENDENCE. We are tight on the autograph of JOHN HANCOCK. We PULL BACK to reveal...  66 67 National Treasure, 4/9/03 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOURISTS crowd around the Declaration of Independence exhibit. Riley finishes counting the signatures.
(looks up, confused) I don't get it. There are 56 signatures. The riddle said "55 in iron pen."

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: The 56th signature, Thomas McKean's, wasn't added until 1781, two years after the Charlotte disappeared. Riley looks to the document again, then shrugs...

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Well, it's still here. Looks like Ian came to his senses.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What're you doing? They turn to find a GUARD standing behind them. He gestur to the line of TOURISTS which snakes through the Rotunda.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're holding up the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Riley exit the building.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: So, we're back. Let's go say "hi" to your dad. Tell him that your treasure hunting days are over. Just then, Ben grabs Riley and pulls him behind a column.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All right. I'm sorry. I know I'm not supposed to talk about your dad. Ben motions with his head, and Riley follows his gaze to. ACROSS THE STREET where Ian and Shaw climb into a SEDAN a drive away. Riley watches them go, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No way. They can't be doing this. This isn't some liquor store. It's the National Archives. It's impossible to break in.  67 68 69 National Treasure, 4/9/03 26.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Nothing's impossible. Ian will hire an expert. Or pay off somebody on the inside. Or both. CLOSE ON the remains of a SHIPWRECK submerged in murky 68 water. A giant fish darts into frame. A goldfish. le WIDEN to see we're in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A studio loft crowded with books, maps, a_computer, SCUBA gear, and many historical items, like a "Don't Tread on M Flag" which is framed but not hanging on the wall. Keys jingle at the door, and it opens to Ben and Riley.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I don't think we're safe here.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Ian thinks we're dead. Suddenly, there's. a noise outside the door. Ben grabs a spear gun, and Riley whips open the door to reveal... ...a LADY. Actually, it's the LANDLADY (mid 59's) who gre the spear gun pointed at her with a bored smile.

dialogues.speaker: LANDLADY
dialogues.text: This is why you can't keep a girlfriend. They sigh, relieved. Ben lowers the spear gun.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Hello, Mrs. Doyle.

dialogues.speaker: LANDLADY
dialogues.text: Did you find it?

dialogues.speaker: BEN RILEY
dialogues.text: Yes. No. She looks at Ben.

dialogues.speaker: LANDLADY
dialogues.text: You know when you talk about Charlotte all the time, it scares the girls away. That last girlfriend you had was really nice too.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I won't be talking about Charlotte ever again.  69 70 71 National Treasure, 4/9/03 27.

dialogues.speaker: LANDLADY
dialogues.text: Does that mean you're settling down now?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY BEN
dialogues.text: Yes. No. Ben digs into his pocket and comes up with the antique po watch he found on the Charlotte.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here. I got something for you... The Landlady inspects the watch, amazed.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...It's 18th Century. French. 14K gold key. Very rare.

dialogues.speaker: LANDLADY
dialogues.text: It's beautiful. Thank you. Ben kneels down and starts rifling through his stacks of books and maps and charts. She watches him.

dialogues.speaker: LANDLADY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know, Ben, what you need to do is stop reading so much, and go out and have some fun.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You're right. We will. Ben stands, holding a stack of books, and we CUT TO... CUT TO CLOSE ON the books, which are_now strewn across a cherry wood desk. We WIDEN to reveal we're in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This 19th Century building is the grandest library in all America. Ben and Riley study a SCHEMATIC at a table.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Every night, the Declaration of Independence is lowered down into the vault room which is directly below the Rotunda... CLOSE ON A BLUEPRINT of the National Archives. We FOLLOW Ben's finger as it traces the path down through the Rotun floor and to the Vault Room right below.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...where it's locked up ina specially at sed, impenetrable,  National Treasure, 4/9/03 28.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: 50-ton, steel vault where it's protected from heat, cold, even a thousand years of nuclear winter. The entire process takes just two minutes, but during those two Minutes, the Declaration of Independence is vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: So that's when Ian's going to do it?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Doubt it. A better time would be to create a situation wherein the Declaration would be automaticall lowered into its vault when guards aren't there.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Well, Ian'd have to create some external chaos because there's no way he can hack in.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Because most of these old government facilities use the old Data-Link encryption-based security system. Once you're in, you can do whatever you want, but only a handful of people know how to get in.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: And would one of those people happen to be someone who gave up a good life at Intel to help save his country?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Could be.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Then, it looks like we have the edge.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: --Whoa-wait-whoa! Holy shit! Ritey's "holy shit" ECHOES LOUDLY through the room. ALL HEADS turn to glare at them. Riley lowers his voice.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You just said "we."  71 72 73 National Treasure, 4/9/03 29.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Yeah. As in me and you.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: No. Nuh-uh. Bad idea.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: What's bad? We take it first so Ian can't steal it.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: You're right. That's not a bad idea. It's an extremely-horrible- get -your-ass-reamed-for-life-in- prison idea.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: It's the only way to protect it.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: How did we go from "let's stop Ian" to "let's take it ourselves"?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You got a better idea?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: As a matter of fact, I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Riley wait. "DR. ABIGAIL CHASE, CHARTERS OF FREED CUSTODIAN" is stenciled on the office door.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You want me to do the talking?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: No, this is my idea. You'll try to make it sound crazy. Just then, a bookishly beautiful DR. ABIGAIL CHASE (26) opens her office door. She sees Ben and Riley.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Good afternoon, gentlemen. Please come in. Ben and Riley exchange a look. She's prettier than they expected her to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abigail moves to her desk as Ben and Riley enter her offi which is decorated with colonial art and Revolutionary Wa era artifacts.  73 National Treasure, 4/9/03 30.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Thanks for seeing us on such short notice, Dr. Chase.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: So, what can I do for you today? Ben eyes Riley like, "go on."

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Okay. This is going to sound crazy, but somebody's going to steal the Declaration of Independence. She regards them disdainfully. She gets this all the time

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: All terrorist threats must be reported directly to the FBI. Let me get you their number. She goes to get the number but is stopped by...

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: This isn't a terrorist threat. The people behind it are treasure hunters.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: And they want to steal the Declaration of Independence because...? Riley looks to Ben, but Ben looks away to a framed antiqu button collection hanging on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: (reluctantly) Because there's a treasure map on the back.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Is this a joke?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: We just found proof in a ship that was wrecked over 200 years ago.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I see. Well, I've seen the back of the Declaration of Independence, and I assure you, there is no map.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Really? You sure?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Absolutely. I've seen it many times.  National Treasure, 4/9/03 31.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Have you ever touched it?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Of course not. No one touches it. It's hermetically sealed in a bullet- proof, thermopane case.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: That must frustrate you. Seeing something everyday and not being able to touch it. There's an undeniable charm about Ben, but Abigail does h best to shrug it off.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I touch the case every day, which is closer than most people will ever get to it. Which makes me the expert in this room about there being or not being a map on the back. Which there is not.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: That's because it's invisible.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: It is?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Invisible inks were common back then. They were used by both the British and American armies to send secret spy letters during the Revolutionary War. Abigail studies Ben, interest piqued.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Or, the parchment could have been palim sest. Animal skin paper wasn't exactly easy to make and was--

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: --often_ cleaned and reused. I know what palimpsest is.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Of course, you do.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: So, do you have any proof? About this "invisible map"?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: It was in a riddle on an old pipe.  73 National Treasure, 4/9/03 32.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: May I see the pipe? Ben and Riley exchange a look, then grudgingly...

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: We don't have it.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Did Bigfoot take it?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I told you it would sound crazy. Ben straightens the framed collection.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Don't touch that, please. Ben refers to an empty space in the button collection.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: 1789 George Washington Campaign Buttons. All you need is the silver- plated Inaugural Button to complete the set. I found one of those once, digging in a back yard in Maryland. You know, they're worth about five thousand dollars.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: (realizes) You're treasure hunters as well.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Formerly. Now, we're more like treasure protectors.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Well, Mr...? Ben reaches out and shakes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Brown. Paul Brown. And this is my friend, Tom Jeffries. She shakes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Well, Mr. Brown and Mr. Jeffries, let_me assure you that the Declaration of Independence is safe. We have a very sophisticated security system designed to stop crazy people dike yourselves from getting near it.  National Treasure, 4/9/03 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Riley move down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Paul Brown and Tom Jeffries?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: When the Declaration of Independence turns up missing, the Feds'll go after anyone who reported it was about to be stolen. Those are common names. They should keep them busy for a while. Buy us some time.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: So, we're really going to do it?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I am. I could use your help. Ben pulls out a handkerchief and starts wiping his hand. Riley nods,

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Once we get it, what are we going to do with it?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Look at the back.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: We would?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Of course. If we don't look at the back, we'll never find the treasure. If we don't find the treasure, someone will always come looking for the map, which means the Declaration of Independence will always be in danger until we find the treasure. liking Ben's reasoning.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Then, we have to look at the back. It's our duty As Americans. Now, Riley notices Ben wiping his hand.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's on your hand?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Ultra-violet ink. Dr. Chase has daily ac access to the vault. I shook er han  74 75 76 77 78 79 National Treasure, 4/9/03 34.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: You knew we were going to do this all along, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I was hoping she would believe us so we wouldn't have to.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Me too. CLOSE ON a woman's fingers as they guickdy punch ina 75 passcode into a keyboard. A beat, then CLUNK. The solenoid lock releases. We WIDEN to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abigail stands at the security entrance to the VAULT ROOM with DR. STANLEY HERBERT (40s, suave intellectual).

dialogues.speaker: DR. HERBERT
dialogues.text: So, you need a ride tomorrow night? I could swing by. Pick you up. He pushes through the heavy security door leading into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A high-tech room of concrete and steel. In the middle of the room, a 50-ton Mosler vault stands open. . A scissor-jack extends out of it and up to a stee SLOT in the ceiling. Abigail and Dr. Herbert enter.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Dr. Herbert, if you came by to pick me up, and we went _to the gala together, that would be like you and me going on a date.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HERBERT
dialogues.text: It's more like car-pooling.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: It's more like a date. And I don't date co-workers.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HERBERT
dialogues.text: I'm not a co-worker. I'm your boss. GRAINY SURVEILLANCE VIDEO OF THE SAME. We WIDEN to reveal we're in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUARDS study a bay of monitors which flip through a rotat of surveillance images covering every inch of the archive  79 80 81 82 83 84 85 National Treasure, 4/9/03

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The head guard JOE WOODRUFF (50s, _ career government emp ZOOMS IN On the VAULT ROOM, then leans into a microphone.

dialogues.speaker: WOODRUFF
dialogues.text: Good evening, Dr. Chase. Dr. Herbert. INTERCUT Abigail and Dr. Herbert in the vault room.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Hi, Joe. She opens a drawer, grabs a hand-held GAS CHROMATOGRAPHER

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ready whenever you are. INTERCUT Woodruff. He grabs a key on the console...

dialogues.speaker: WOODRUFF
dialogues.text: This is why they pay me the big bucks. He turns the key, and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scissor-jack springs to life and starts to retract...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two GUARD patrolling the empty Rotunda watch as... The DECLARATION OF INDEPENDENCE is lowered in its case fr its exhibit. We PUSH IN on it and FOLLOW it as... THE SCISSOR- JACK retracts, pulting the DECLARATION OF INDEPENDENCE through a steel slot in the FLOOR and into..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the scissor-jack retracts, the Declaration of Independ descends in its case from the slot in the ceiling. Abigail steps up to the document and waves the gas chromatographer along the thermopane case's edges. The instrument whizzes and hums, all apparently normal noises

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: You ever wonder if there was something on the Declaration of Independence that might have been overlooked?

dialogues.speaker: DR. HERBERT
dialogues.text: That document's been examined more than a corn farmer on an alien space ship. 79 80 81 82 83 84 85  85 86 87 88 89 90 National Treasure, 4/9/03 36.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Everything we know of early Archimedes came from palimpsest overlooked for centuries. The Declaration reaches the vault, then tips backwards.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HERBERT
dialogues.text: If you're angling for a grant, you're oing to have to come up with some- hing better than that. You don't want people to think you're crazy. The Declaration lies back in the vault, then the 5-TON ST VAULT DOORS slide closed with a LOUD THUNK as we CUT TO..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Directly across the street from the National Archives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrying a briefcase, Ben and Riley descend on an ESCALAT into this modern, spacious station. The platforms are crowded with COMMUTERS. Ben and Riley step off the escalator and move through the throng to the far end of the platform. Ben waits for the train to pull away, then... JUMPS DOWN ONTO THE TRACKS. Riley reluctantly follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Riley hurry along the tracks. The dim glow of a flashlight lights only a few yards ahead of them. They finally come to a door bolted closed with a heavy lo and stop. en pulls some bolt cutters out of the briefcase

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Riley work in this cramped public works substatio Using a HAND-HELD ELECTRICAL SAW with a 2" circular blade Ben finishes cutting a hole in one of the many PVC pipes that run along the ceiling of the substation. Riley opens the briefcase and pulls out... A TOY TRACTOR TRUCK, actually a sophisticated remote-oper vehicle (ROV) with a camera taped to the hood. We CUT TO.

dialogues.speaker: GOD'S EYE VIEW OF PENNSYLVANIA AVENUE. EVENING. 90
dialogues.text: People, Cars. Buses. The National Archives on one side of the street. The Green Line Subway Station on the other.  90 91 92 93 94 95 96 97 98 99 100 National Treasure, 4/9/03 37.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We PUSH down toward the pavement. Closer, closer, until w butt up to it, then SEAMLESSLY MOVE through the pavement. UNDERGROUND. We TRAVEL vertically through the layers of 9 concrete, rocks, dirt, concrete again. t opens up into... A LABYRINTH OF PIPES, FIBER-OPTICS, GAS, ELECTRIC. We PUS INTO one pipe and MOVE seamlessly inside... THE PIPE. We're moving in the direction of the National 9 Archives finally catc ing up to the ROV. Its motor whirs. Its headlights play on a turn in the pipe ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley navigates the ROV with a JOYSTICK and a LAPTOP whic plays back what the ROV is seeing.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Around five. Why?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I'd be getting off work about now. At Intel. ON THE SCREEN, the ROV arrives at an intimidating MATRIX CONDUIT wrapped in a bunch.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There it is. He punches a key on the laptop. Maneuvers the joystick. IN THE PIPE. The ROV stops, extends a MECHANICAL ARM, 95 finds a red wire, and CLIPS ON TIGHT. With a WHOOSH... We RUSH into the wire and TRAVEL, light-speed to... 96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUARDS monitor the surveillance bay. ON ONE MONITOR, we see video of the VAULT ROOM. INTERCUT THE LAPTOP SCREEN on which the same surveillance video plays. We're back in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and_ Riley study the surveillance feed of the vault r on the laptop screen. The vault stares back at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Riley exit the station.  100 101 102 103 National Treasure, 4/9/03 38.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: So, when are we doing this?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: If we're going to beat Ian, we've got to_do it tomorrow night during he gala. Ben gestures across the street to the National Archives. Red-white-and-blue Banners hang between the fluted column announcing its 75th Anniversary Gala tomorrow night.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: There'll be hundreds of people there.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Hundreds of very important people. Any glitch in the system, and the guards will have their hands full protecting the dignitaries. Riley considers that, then...

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I suppose while I'm hacking into the Archives Security System, you'll be needing me to get you on their guest list as well.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You're talents would've been wasted at Intel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pennsylvania Avenue is lined with limos and luxury sedans as tuxedo'd MEN and WOMEN in designer gowns arrive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUESTS pass through metal detectors at the check-in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small STRING ORCHESTRA plays while hundreds of GUESTS Mingle in the Rotunda. Looking stunning in her sparkly formal gown, Abigail stands with Dr. Herbert.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: What do you think Thomas Jefferson would say if he were here?

dialogues.speaker: DR. HERBERT
dialogues.text: He'd say, "Abigail, you need to find a man of whom you are as passionate about as you are of me... who's not dead."  103 104 105 106 107 National Treasure, 4/9/03 39.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We TRAVEL through the throng and come to a HEAVY-SET SENA sipping wine. We CUT TO... VIDEO SURVEILLANCE OF THE SAME. We WIDEN to reveal... 104

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley sits in the back of this van, sipping coffee and watching surveillance feeds on his laptop. ON THE SCREEN, he ZOOMS IN ON the FAT SENATOR.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: (sings to the tune of Santa Claus is coming to Town) "He sees you when you're drinking..." He pans to a smarmy MAN flirting with a pretty LADY.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "He knows when you are cheating..." He ZOOMS in until the pretty lady's butt fills the screen

dialogues.speaker: RILEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "...He knows when you left your panties at home..." As Riley zooms in on the butt, we transition to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same LADY live in the Rotunda with the smarmy man. We PAN across the crowd and finally find... BEN, wearing a tuxedo and staring at the Declaration of Independence.

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sir? Ben turns to find a WAITER with a tray of champagne.

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: Champagne? Ben smiles and takes a glass of champagne. He then looks to a SURVEILLANCE CAMERA mounted on the wall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE LAPTOP SCREEN, Ben is looking right at Riley. He tips his glass to him as he talks under his breath...

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Here's to freedom.  107 108 109 110 National Treasure, 4/9/03

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Riley holds up his coffee cup and leans into a microphone

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Our last night of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They toast. Ben looks to the Declaration of Independence.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Maybe this is a bad idea.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY, (VIA MIC)
dialogues.text: No, it's a good idea. INTERCUT Riley. He studies the laptop screen.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (VIA MIC)
dialogues.text: We don't know about Ian. sure. Riley spots something on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Yes, we do. He's here. ON THE LAPTOP SCREEN, we now see Ian and his men unloadin a catering truck near the back entrance to the Archives. Not for Not good news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben moves purposefully across the Rotunda.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? Ben turns and sees Abigail. Tonight, she's simply captivating. She takes Ben's breath away.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Dr. Chase...

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Mr. Brown, I don't remember seeing your name on the guest list.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I made a last minute donation. 111 INTERCUT Riley in the van, watching Ben and Abigail.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL, (VIA MIC)
dialogues.text: Shouldn't you be out robbing graves or desecrating something?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: No time for mingling. 40. 107 108 109 110 1414  112 113 National Treasure, 4/9/03 41. ON Ben and Abigail. 112

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: The night's still young. Abigail can't help but smile at that. She eyes him.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: So, I've been wondering...what did the riddle say?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: The riddle?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: On the pipe that Bigfoot took. Your friend said there was a riddle. What did it say? Just then, Dr. Herbert arrives with two glasses of champa

dialogues.speaker: DR. HERBERT
dialogues.text: Abigail, your drink. Dr. Herbert hands Abigail a glass, not happy she's alread hooked up with somebody at the party.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HERBERT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who's your friend? Ben reaches to shake his hand.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Paul Brown. And you must be Dr. Herbert.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HERBERT
dialogues.text: You know me?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I referenced your paper on Feudalistic Influence in the Southern Colonies in my thesis.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HERBERT
dialogues.text: Oh, you're an academic?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woodruff and the GUARDS watch the surveillance bay. We PUSH IN ON A MONITOR with a feed of the back service entrance where the catering workers unload foodstuffs fro a truck. The POV pans back and forth as we CUT TO...  114 115 116 117 118 National Treasure, 4/9/03 AN ARMOR DOME CAMERA doing its sweep. We WIDEN to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaw waits for the camera to pan away, then aims a tricke out HV TASER GUN and FIRES... BOOOSH! Two electrodes attached to insulated wires shoot out of the gun at 100mph, latch onto the camera dome, the pump 100,000 volts into the camera. The camera sputters and sparks, shorted out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monitor CUTS TO SNOW. Woodruff gets on his radio.

dialogues.speaker: WOODRUFF
dialogues.text: Ferguson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GUARD patrolling the service corridor gets on his radio

dialogues.speaker: GUARD FERGUSON
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: WOODRUFF, (VIA MIC)
dialogues.text: We lost perimeter camera seven. Go check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben stands with Abigail and Dr. Herbert. Ben looks around anxious.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HERBERT
dialogues.text: So, Mr. Brown, what brings you here tonight?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: High treason. They regard Ben, curious.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's what the 56 men, by signing the Declaration of Independence were committing. Had we lost the war, they'd have been hanged, beheaded, drawn and quartered, or my personal favorite, had their entrails cut out and burned while they were still alive. Ben grabs a drink off a passing tray and holds it up. 114 115 116 117 118  118 119 120 1214 122 National Treasure, 4/9/03 43.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In fact, let's toast them. To the brave men who did what was considered wrong in order to do what they knew was right. Dr. Herbert toasts enthusiastically. So does Abigail, although more guardedly.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now, if you'll excuse me. Ben leaves. Abigail watches him go, suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HERBERT
dialogues.text: Charming man. I liked him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guard Ferguson arrives at the back service entrance, stop and keys in his passcode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guard Ferguson pushes open the door and is greeted by... BOOOSH! The probes hit him square in his chest, and then surge of high voltage knocks him on his ass. IAN and HIS MEN enter, stepping over the unconscious guar Ian shuts the service entrance. Shaw opens a BLACK DUFFEL BAG. Grabs some duct tape and nylon rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same snowy surveillance feed plays on Riley's laptop.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Ian took out the service entrance camera. Ten-to-one he's inside already. We should've done this last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben heads down the museum walkway, which is crowded with gala guests. He talks sotto into his hidden mic.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Last night, the building was locked down, like it is every night. That's why we're doing it tonight.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY, (VIA MIC)
dialogues.text: That's why Ian's doing it tonight too.  122 123 124 125 126 127 128 129 National Treasure, 4/9/03 44.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: It's OK. I can beat him there. Ben stops. Around the corner is a set of elevators. A surveillance camera monitors the elevator foyer. INTERCUT RILEY watching the feed of the elevator foyer. 1

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (VIA MIC)
dialogues.text: Go. On cue, Riley presses a key, and ON THE SCREEN, a new win opens, so that there are two windows on the screen. Both show an EMPTY elevator foyer.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Zap! You're the Invisible Man. He types a command and presses ENTER. We RUSH in on the ENTER key. Move light-speed, through th computer, out the USB cable, up the antenna and into... The tiny ANTENNA on the ROV which is still parked inside the PIPE and patched into the security system...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUARDS monitor the surveillance bay. There is a tiny hicc barely noticeable, as the video of switches over.

dialogues.speaker: WOODRUFF
dialogues.text: Has Ferguson checked back in yet? We PUSH IN on the empty foyer video and TRANSITION to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RILEY'S LAPTOP SCREEN, the same video plays in one of the windows. It's a previously recorded loop of the EMPTY foy In the window, the loop is labeled "PLAYBACK." In the other window, the real surveillance feed of Ben in the foyer plays. This feed is labeled "LIVE."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben_ steps onto the elevator, punches the "B" for basemen call button, and the elevator starts to descend.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You see Ian anywhere? INTERCUT Riley checking surveillance feeds on his laptop.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (VIA MIC)
dialogues.text: Let's do this. Riley keys in a command on his keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: OK. On my go, you have exactly-- INTERCUT Ben, setting the timer on his wristwatch. 130

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: --Two minutes. I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ian, Shaw, Powell, and Shippen move down a corridor to a stairwell access door. On it, a sign reads, "ALARMED ENTR AUTHORIZED ACCESS ONLY." Ian looks to his men.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Time to take history. He pulls out a REMOTE. Presses a button. A red light FLASHES as we CUT TO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STEEL TRANSFORMER BOX across the street from the Nation Archives EXPLODES, showering the street in SPARKS and FIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the Rotunda, the lights flicker and go out. The PARTY GUESTS all react to the power outage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator lights also flicker and go out, and the elev suddenly...JERKS TO A STOP! INTERCUT RILEY in the van. ON HIS LAPTOP, the video feeds all cut to snow.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Shit-shit-shit! That wasn't me. INTERCUT BEN in the elevator. He punches all of the call buttons, but the elevator is stuck.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Ian blew a transformer. INTERCUT Riley, realizing... 137

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: A power outage will trigger the emergency protocol.  138 139 140 141 142 143 National Treasure, 4/9/03 46. INTERCUT Ben. He starts his stopwatch. 138

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: That means the Declaration is on its way down already. He tries to pull open the elevator doors to no avail. He looks around, mind ticking.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Trigger the alarms. We gotta stop an. INTERCUT Riley. He stares at his laptop screen filled wit flashing security messages.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: The power outage already tripped . all the alarms. Everything's going off. Guards won't know what's Ian and what's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE SURVEILLANCE BAY, every light is indeed blinking.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Sir, we've lost surveillance and main power.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Emergency protocol's been initiated.

dialogues.speaker: WOODRUFF
dialogues.text: Switch to auxiliary, then reboot and run a systems check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murmurs sweep across the crowd of politicians as the Declaration of Independence exhibit is automatically lowe into the Rotunda flooring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guards frantically try to get their systems back up.

dialogues.speaker: WOODRUFF
dialogues.text: I_want every available body on the floor. Let's make sure our party guests are safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Auxiliary power kicks in, and the lights come back on. A GUARD steps in to calm the crowd.  143 144 145 146 147 148 149 150 151 152 National Treasure, 4/9/03 47.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: We just had a little power outage, but’ everything's under control. You'll notice the documents are being lowered into their vaults, but this is just standard procedure. They will be back shortly... Abigail and Dr. Herbert exchange concerned looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben slides a ceiling tile aside, but just then, the eleva powers back up and starts descending again. INTERCUT Riley in the van. He checks the stopwatch.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: 96 seconds. CUT TO CLOSE ON a THERMIC LANCE burning at 7000°F, cuttin through solid steel. We WIDEN to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaw cuts through the SECURITY DOOR with the thermic lanc Ian checks his watch. A beat, Shaw finishes cutting throu the steel dead bolts, and the DOOR RELEASES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The orchestra starts playing again, and the waiters start serving drinks, quelling the crowd. Abigail watches the Declaration of Independence disappear from its exhibit. Her spider-senses are tingling. INTERCUT THE DECLARATION OF INDEPENDENCE, moving by sciss jack into the sub-flooring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ian and his men charge down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator DINGS open, and Ben slips into this long corridor. Ben moves quickly to... The huge steel VAULT ROOM DOOR at the end of the hall. There is a keyboard pad here, the same one Abigail punche her passcode in earlier. INTERCUT Riley in the van, watching the time tick down.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: 57 seconds... 143 144 145 146 147 148 149 150 151 152  153 154 155 156 157 National Treasure, 4/9/03 48. INTERCUT BEN. He pulls what looks like a THIN SLIDE VIEWE out of his jacket pocket. He holds it over the keypad and switches on its blue light... THROUGH THE VIEWER GLASS, certain letters on the keypad GLOW with ULTRAVIOLET FINGERPRINTS. Ben reads them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley keys the letters into_an ANAGRAM GENERATOR on his computer. The results scroll across the screen: A GLOVE FRY, A VERY GOLF, A GROVE FRY, FARGO LEVY, GRAVY FLOWE.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: (reads from the screen) "A glove fry, a very golt, Fargo levy, gravy flowe, valey frog. Any of these make any sense?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben stares at the letters, realizes...

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: It's Valley Forge. She pressed "L" and "E" twice. He dons a WHITE GLOVE, then punches in the code, "Valley Forge." A beat, then the VAULT ROOM DOOR unlocks with a series of CLUNKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweating Shaw is now cutting through a second security door with the thermic lance.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: How much time? Ian checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: We're right on schedule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben jumps up on the vault. The scissor jack has_completel retracted, and the vault doors are starting to close. No time to hesitate... Ben lifts the Declaration of Independence (in its thermop gase) out of the vault just as the steel doors close with ou .  158 159 160 161 162 National Treasure, 4/9/03 49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The surveillance bay is aglow with flashing lights as the system_runs through its automatic checks. All the surveillance screens are still snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaw finishes cutting through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrying the Declaration in its case, Ben races back to t elevator. He pushes the call button just as... The stairwell access door OPENS, and through it emerge IA SHAW, POWELL, and SHIPPEN. They surprised to see Ben's no only alive, but he's got their quarry.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: He's alive.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Not for long. SHAW OPENS FIRE on Ben with an automatic gun and silencer Ben whips the Declaration of Independence around, and USE IT AS A SHIELD to protect himself. The Declaration of Independence is ABSOLUTELY RIDDLED WIT

dialogues.speaker: BULLETS
dialogues.text: But the bullets BOUNCE OFF THE DECLARATION OF INDEPENDENC THERMOPANE CASE which is made of bullet-proof glass. The force of the bullets knocks Ben into the ELEVATOR as DINGS OPEN... Ian suddenly grabs Shaw's arm. His shots go astray, rakin the metal elevator doors which finally close. daatge the matter with you?! You'll

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben falls inside, then bangs on the call-button panel. INTERCUT Riley in the van. He's heard the commotion. 162

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Ben? Ben?!

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (VIA MIC)
dialogues.text: I got it.  162 163 164 165 166 167 168 National Treasure, 4/9/03 50.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We can now hear SIRENS approaching.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: You'd better hurry. INTERCUT BEN IN THE ELEVATOR. He sets the case down and 1 pulls two DROPPERS OF VISINE out of his pants pocket.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You'd better not leave. Ben takes one of the droppers and carefully drops a singl DROP on each of the four bolts in the corners of the Declaration of Independence's case. Ben then grabs the second DROPPER OF VISINE and drops a second set of drops on the bolts. When the two drops of liquid combine, the BOLTS BEGIN TO SMOKE AND SMOLDER. Ben checks the elevator panel. The elevator ascends...

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to the chemicals) Come on...come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ian and his men charge back up the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and burst into the empty corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SMOLDERING dissipates, and Ben pulls the case apart. The argon gas vents from the interior with a HISS-WHOOSH! Ben gingerly lifts the precious document out, quickly rol it Ue then pulls a HEAVY-DUTY, CLEAR PLASTIC CYLINDRICAL BAGGIE out of his jacket pocket... ...and carefully SLIPS THE DOCUMENT INTO THE BAGGIE.
