dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woodruff watches as one-by-one, the monitors on the surveillance bay start coming back up online.

dialogues.speaker: WOODRUFF
dialogues.text: Dammit. What happened to Ferguson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ELEVATOR DINGS open, and Ben steps out.  169 170 171 172 National Treasure, 4/9/03 51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben rounds the corner and casually melts into the crowd. He heads for the exit, but just a few yards ahead is... ABIGAIL. Ben ducks into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GALA GUESTS peruse the souvenirs. Head down, Ben watches_ as Abigail passes by outside the gift shop window. He wai a beat, then moves to exit. But he's stopped by...

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, sir! Ben looks up. The CLERK working the register regards him.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: You trying to steal that? Ben looks down and realizes the Declaration of Independen is poking out of his jacket. He's busted. Then... He notices he's standing next to a bin filled with "ACTUA SIZE DECLARATION OF INDEPENDENCE Reproductions." Each one wrapped in heavy plastic just like the real one.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: $35?! It's just a piece of paper. He digs into his pockets and comes up with several rumple bills and coins. He quickly counts them out, but...

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I only have $32.57.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: We take ATM and credit cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUARDS search the corridor but find no sign of Ferguson.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD, (VIA RADIO)
dialogues.text: I can't find Ferguson. Woodruff is distressed by the news.

dialogues.speaker: WOODRUFF
dialogues.text: This isn't good.  172 173 174 175 176 177 178 179 180 181 National Treasure, 4/9/03 52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We FOLLOW GUARDS' FEET sprinting down the inner corridor.

dialogues.speaker: THE GUARDS PUSH OPEN THE VAULT DOOR... 175
dialogues.text: IN THE FOYER, Ben pushes by guests, almost to the exit... IN THE SECURITY STATION, Woodruff turns the key on the 17 console and prays...

dialogues.speaker: WOODRUFF
dialogues.text: Please be there...please God, let it be there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrying the "souvenir," Ben hurries down the sidewalk in front of the National Archives.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey! Abigail catches up to him, but Ben keeps moving.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: What's what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ian and his men burst out the back service exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vault's steel doors slide open, revealing the bad new

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woodruff sees the empty vault on the surveillance screen. He hits the ALARM and gets on his radio.

dialogues.speaker: WOODRUFF
dialogues.text: Code Red. Code Red. We have a break in! Lock it down. Nobody leaves the building. Woodruff looks around. He can't believe this is happening

dialogues.speaker: WOODRUFF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Romebody get the FBI on the phone! ow!  182 183 184 National Treasure, 4/9/03 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abigail follows Ben as he hurries across the street.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: What's that? That in your hand.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: A souvenir. Got it at the gift shop. They reach the van, where Riley waits, engine running.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Let's go! Just then, the National Archives ALARMS SOUND! Abigail's face falls. She knows what Ben has done.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: You didn't.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You wouldn't understand. Ben reaches for the van door, but Abigail SCREAMS...

dialogues.speaker: POLICE
dialogues.text: Ben panics, grabs her, covers her mouth, but she BITES hi and...COMES UP WITH THE DECLARATION OF INDEPENDENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ian and his men climb into their catering truck, Ian sees... Ben standing across the street with Abigail who is holdin the Declaration of Independence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abigail looks at the rolled up parchment, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Careful with that!

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Oh. My. God. Riley sees she has IT now and puts his head in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: (sotto) Oh my God.  National Treasure, 4/9/03 54.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (to Abigail) You're making a big mistake--

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: --You weren't protecting it. You're stealing it.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Listen. There are some very bad people, people who don't care about the Declaration of Independence, people who only see it as a map.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: You're pathetic. With that, she turns and starts crossing the street, the Declaration of Independence in her hand. Ben hurries to get into the van.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Come on. Let's go. Riley watches Abigail leaving with the Declaration.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: But. You can't just let her go.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Yes, we can. Suddenly, the CATERING TRUCK barrels down on Abigail in t middle of the street. She side-steps out of its way, but it SCREECHES TO A STOP in front of her, blocking her path Ben sees the truck's driver...it's Shippen.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh no. The truck's back doors burst gpen, and Ian, Shaw, and Pow jump out and swarm Abigail. She struggles like a wild cat Ben moves to help her, but Powell opens fire on him, send Ben diving for cover behind the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley ducks as the van is raked with bullets. The van's windows shatter. Glass shards pepper the interior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ian and Shaw throw Abigail into the back of the truck. Powell jumps into the Cab, and the truck peels out.  187 188 189 190 191 192 193 194 195 National Treasure, 4/9/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben jumps in, and Riley slams it into gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The catering truck wheels through traffic. A beat behind, the van blows through a red light and flies after it.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Abigail holds the Declaration of Independence. Ian holds out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Give it to me.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Over my dead body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The catering truck turns hard and slews onto 3rd Street. A dozen POLICE CARS speed by them, going the other way, toward the National Archives.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The truck veers suddenly, sending Abigail on her ass. Ian snatches the Declaration of Independence out of her hand she stumbles.

A scenic street if anyone had time to look. The U.S. Capi on one side, the Washington Monument on the other. The van gains on the catering truck, but Powell leans out the passenger side window and OPENS FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Ben and Riley duck as the front windshield EXPLODES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van falls back.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Abigail watches helplessly as Ian holds the Declaration o Independence.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ian ignores her. Slips the document from its cover.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: What do we do with her? Ian starts unrolling the document. Doesn't look up.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: No witnesses. Shaw turns his gun on Abigail. Abigail's eyes search the truck. Looking for a way out...

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT 196
dialogues.text: Riley pulls alongside the driver's side of the catering truck, then he YANKS the wheel hard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van SLAMS into the catering truck just as...

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT 198
dialogues.text: Shaw cocks his gun, squeezes the trigger, but the truck shakes violently ON IMPACT, sending Shaw on his ass. Abigail scrabbles to the truck's back doors, but they're latched shut. Irked, Shaw moves to finish her off. But just then, Ian notices something about the document that makes him go...

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Wait. Ian looks up, then turns the document to Abigail.

dialogues.speaker: IAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell is this? Abigail looks at the document, and is dust as surprised a Ian. Stamped on the document is a PRI . e grins.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: A souvenir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van slaloms traffic and pulls alongside the truck.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT 200
dialogues.text: Ian looks to Abigail, who stands by the truck's back door

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Who are you?  200 201 202 203 204 205 206 207 National Treasure, 4/9/03 57.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Abigail talks, she reaches behind her back and surreptitiously unlatches the door latch...

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: (stalling) I'm Dr. Abigail Chase, Executive Custodian of the Charters of Freedom for the National Archives.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT 201
dialogues.text: Ben moves to the back of the van and slides open the van' side door.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT 202
dialogues.text: Shippen sees Ben in the van and whips the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The catering truck YAWS into the van.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT 204
dialogues.text: Abigail finally manages to unlatch the latch.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Who are you-- Just then, the truck is rocked as it SLAMS into the van. Ian and Shaw are buried by a cascade of chafing dishes. The truck's back doors to SWING OPEN WILDLY. Abigail just manages to grab the latch, and she ARCS OUT INTO traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TOUR BUS motors along in the heavy D.C. traffic, passin the Jefferson Memorial, beautifully lit at night.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT 206
dialogues.text: A GROUP OF TOURISTS crane their necks out their windows a a TOUR GUIDE zealously describes the sights.

dialogues.speaker: TOUR GUIDE
dialogues.text: ...And over to your right, you can see the Jefferson Memorial. Who can tell me what important document Thomas Jefferson authored? Nobody answers. Instead, they're all glued to the action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abigail dangles off the door, both hands gripping the lat  208 209 210 211 212 213 214 215 National Treasure, 4/9/03 58.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT 208
dialogues.text: Riley maneuvers the van up to the back of the catering tr Ben holds onto the door frame and reaches out to Abigail.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Grab my hand! Holding on for dear life, she looks to Ben like he's craz

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: With what?!

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT 209
dialogues.text: Riley fights the wheel, holding steady. Looks ahead_to se A TRAFFIC JAM. Total gridlock. A sea of red brake lights.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Uh... hurry!

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT 210
dialogues.text: Ben reaches for Abigail.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Come on! Abigail summons up her courage, lets go of one hand, and SWINGS toward Ben. Their fingers almost touch...

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT 211
dialogues.text: But there's no more room to go. Riley brakes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van and Ben suddenly decelerate away from Abigail who almost falls.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT 213
dialogues.text: The van falls back, and Shippen looks ahead and sees why. PARKED CARS locked in traffic. Shippen SLAMS on the brake

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The catering truck tires BURN RUBBER.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT 215
dialogues.text: The sudden stop sends Ian and Shaw asses over elbows. The truck's doors SWING ABIGAIL BACK INSIDE, then close behind her. Abigail's now back in the truck in front of a angry firing squad. Shaw turns his gun on her...  216 217 218 219 220 221 222 National Treasure, 4/9/03 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben hurries to the back of the catering truck and yanks t handle just as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaw SHOOTS! But Abigail disappears as the truck door swi open again. The errant bullets blow out the windshield of AN ONCOMING TANKER TRUCK. The tanker truck driver yanks the wheel hard and slams on his brakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tanker truck JACK-KNIFES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ian and Shaw watch in horror as the jack-knifed tanker tr slews uncontrollably toward them. They dive out of the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shippen lays on his HORN, not seeing what Powell sees in his rearview mirror....the runaway juggernaut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWELL and other MOTORISTS SCRAMBLE out of their cars, DUCKING and DIVING out of the way of the TANKER TRUCK... ...which SHIPPEN finally sees. Too late.

dialogues.speaker: EACH CAR IN FRONT OF THE CATERING TRUCK PLOWS INTO THE CA
dialogues.text: in front of it. Metal crumples, glass shatters, tires POP IAN, SHAW, and POWELL come up from the smoking mayhem. Ia looks down the shoulder where he sees... BEN and RILEY'S VAN blow past the pile-up. The van pulls off an off-ramp and disappears.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Piss!

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT 222
dialogues.text: Riley drives, pedal to the metal. Ben sits in the back with a flustered Abigail.  222 National Treasure, 4/9/03 60.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You all right?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: No, I'm not all right! Where's the Declaration of Independence? She immediately starts searching the van. Riley glances i the rearview mirror and sees her searching the van.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: What do you mean "where is it"? You had it!

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I didn't have it. He gave me a fake. Riley looks to Ben, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: You did? (between his teeth) Then, why'd we go after her, Ben?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Ben? I thought your name was Paul.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I had to lie. My real name is Ben Gates. Benjamin Franklin Gates.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I'm supposed to believe that?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Being named after one of America's founding fathers is sort of like a tradition in my family.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: An obsession, actually.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Where is the real the Declaration of Independence?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Don't worry. It's safe. Abigail stops searching. Eyes him.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: So you did steal it.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: If I hadn't, those men would have.  222 223 224 225 National Treasure, 4/9/03 61.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Give it to me. I have to return it.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I can't let you do that. That guy who tried to kill you will just come after it again.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: We'll warn the authorities. They'll protect it.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Like they did tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The building is now cordoned off and swarming with POLICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEN and WOMEN in FBI blazers enter with Woodruff. Leading the group is SADUSKY (40s), solidly built, a complete pro

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: What're we dealing with?

dialogues.speaker: WOODRUFF
dialogues.text: A break-in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The detained guests wait impatiently in the Rotunda. Sadu and his team enters and take charge of the room.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: All right, my name is Sadusky. I am Agent In Charge. I want this building cleared and sealed off. Security clearance only. Sadusky turns to a female agent, AGENT DAWES.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A complete list of names of everyone on tonight's guest list and their dates. Find out who's NOT here. Agent Dawes peels off, and Sadusky turns to AGENT JOHNSON

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The vault and dobby security dogs and all the surveillance tapes for the last 30 days. Agent Johnson nods and peels off, and Sadusky turns to tw more agents, AGENT COLFAX and AGENT HENDRICKS.  National Treasure, 4/9/03 62.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The cars in the underground parking garage. Find any not accounted for. Colfax and Hendricks leave, and Sadusky turns to Woodruff

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want the names and shift schedules of everybody with access to the building. From the janitors to the curator.

dialogues.speaker: WOODRUFF
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: Now, Mr. Woodruff, if you can please tell me what exactly was taken? Woodruff gulps, can barely choke out the words...

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT 226
dialogues.text: Riley pulls onto a highway.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: There's no map on the back of the Declaration of Independence.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Ever heard of the Templar Knights?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: they were a military order of the Catholic Church dissolved by the Pope in the 14th century.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: After King Philip of France had them all burned at the stake.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: That's only a legend.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: The Templar Knights are what legends are made of. Noble men with no allegiance to any state or ruler. Their cause was to protect innocent people from tyrannical rulers and oppression. n 1307, they broke into a Wasigothic stronghold in Languedoc, France and found a treasure so massive it took six days to exhume. They had taken a vow of poverty and swore to protect the treasure, using it only for the (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: National Treasure, 4/9/03 63.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: noblest purpose. King Philip wanted the treasure...if he could only find it. He had the Knights arrested and tortured, but none ever confessed to the treasure's whereabouts. The few Knights who'd evaded capture hid the treasure for almost 200 years, then finally brought it to he one place where there were no kings and no religious persecution, the New World. Christopher Columbus, not so coincidentally, was a descendant of the Knights.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: What do the pempiar Knights have to do with the Declaration’ Ben pulls_a one-dollar bill out of his pocket and points the symbols on the back.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: The all-seeing eye. The unfinished pyramid. These are the marks of the Templar. Our founding fathers were descendants of the Knights. They put the map on the back. Abigail just looks at Ben. An incredulous beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: This is crazy. I'm calling the police. Stop the car. Riley doesn't slow down.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You wish to add kidnapping to your list of federal offenses?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: You can get out whenever you want. Abigail glances out the window. They're going about 7@mph

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Fine. I will! She reaches for the door handle.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Do you still want to hear the riddle from the pipe? That stops Abigail. She turns him, listening.  226 227 National Treasure, 4/9/03 64.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "The legend writ, the stain effected The key in Silence undetected Fifty-five in iron pen Mr. Matlack can't offend."

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Timothy Matlack? The calligrapher of the Declaration of Independence?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: The pipe came from Mt. Vernon. Abigail digests this, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: If that's true, the pipe is a major American historical find.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Yeah well, Ian already has it, and he'll take the Declaration too if we don't protect it.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: How do I know you're not lying?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: We look at the back. Abigail considers that, then looks Ben square in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: All right. But if there's nothing on the back, you're turning yourselves in.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Deal. Because if there's nothing on the back, the Declaration's safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two EMTs work on Guard Ferguson who is conscious now. He sits propped up against a wall, talking to Agent Dawes.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD FERGUSON
dialogues.text: The_only thing I remember is the smell of my hair burning. ON SADUSKY who approaches. Agent Dawes nods to Guard Ferguson, then joins Sadusky down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT DAWES
dialogues.text: They got him with a taser gun at the service entrance.  227 228 National Treasure, 4/9/03 65.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: Did he see the shooter? Anything? Agent Dawes shakes her head, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FBI_ forensics TECHNICIANS work the crime scene, studying bullet casings and dusting for fingerprints. Sadusky move down the corridor with Dr. Herbert and Woodruff.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: Rounds were fired, and nobody heard anything?

dialogues.speaker: WOODRUFF
dialogues.text: The vault corridor is lined with three feet of steel and concrete. Sadusky studies the walls pocked with bullet holes.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: We get a description from the guards?

dialogues.speaker: WOODRUFF
dialogues.text: Which guards?

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: The guards that were fired upon.

dialogues.speaker: WOODRUFF
dialogues.text: There were no guards on patrol down here. Sadusky moves to the elevator which is also bullet-riddle

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: Then, who were the thieves shooting at? Just then, Agent Colfax calls from the stalled elevator.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT COLFAX, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Found it! Sadusky, Woodruff and Dr. Herbert move to... THE ELEVATOR. Agent Hendricks stands above the elevator car in the shaft. He hands THE EMPTY THERMOPANE DISPLAY CASE down to Agent Colfax from its hiding place.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT HENDRICKS
dialogues.text: Looks like they used a dibasic acid to dissolve the bolts. Dr. Herbert looks so broken up, he just might cry.  National Treasure, 4/9/03 66.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dr. Herbert 228

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: Get a copy of the Declaration in place before opening tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HERBERT
dialogues.text: Yes, absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: No word goes to the public. Everything is to appear normal. does his best to compose himself.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HERBERT
dialogues.text: Who would do such a thing?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT HENDRICKS
dialogues.text: Anti-government terrorists. Just then, Agent Johnson steps up.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT JOHNSON
dialogues.text: Computerized security records indicate that a Dr. Abigail Chase accessed the vault at 9:32pm tonight.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HERBERT
dialogues.text: Dr. Chase? Impossible. I was with her at that time. Agent Johnson shows Sadusky a copy of Abigail's ID photo. Dr. Herbert approaches,

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: Who is she?

dialogues.speaker: DR. HERBERT
dialogues.text: The Charters of Freedom Custodian.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT JOHNSON
dialogues.text: The one in charge of the Declaration of Independence.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: Where is she? Let's talk to her.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT JOHNSON
dialogues.text: Unaccounted for, sir. is upset by the news. Now, Agent Dawes carrying a computer printout.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT DAWES
dialogues.text: A man named Benjamin Gates used his credit card in the gift shop at 9:39pm. He wasn't on the guest list. We got an address from the credit card company.  228 229 230 231 National Treasure, 4/9/03 67.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: Gift shop? What the hell did this * guy buy?

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT 229
dialogues.text: Ben roots around under the seat. Comes up with a Big-Gulp cup. Tosses it aside. Finally comes up with a cardboard mailing tube. He peels off an old cheeseburger wrapper stuck to it, then hands it to Abigail. *

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Here. Abigail opens the tube and partially pulls out the docume The aged parchment is clearly visible through the plastic She's awe-struck.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: You are not to touch this ever again! She slips the document back inside the tube.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Fine by me. I never wanted to touch it in the first place.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: You don't deserve to touch it.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Let's just look at the map. That way nobody will ever have to touch it again.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Not here.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: What do you mean "not here"?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Not in the back of a van. We'll need chemicals. A controlled environment. A clean room with particulate air filtration. ESD attire. I hope you have all that. CUT TO - A DOOR BURSTS OPEN, and a SWAT TEAM swarms in, a in black, bullet-proof gear, helmets, lights, guns. We WIDEN to reveal that we're in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrouds of plastic hang over the windows. Beams of light cut through the darkness as the team moves swiftly throug the room. A beat, then a SWAT team member calls out...  231 232 233 National Treasure, 4/9/03 68.

dialogues.speaker: SWAT COP
dialogues.text: Interior secure!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadusky and his team move down the hallway. Agent Dawes reads from a printout.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT DAWES
dialogues.text: Ben Franklin Gates used his Visa on a one-way plane ticket from Toronto to D.C. two days ago after spending seven months unaccounted for. Before that, his paper trail's got him all over the place. Boston, France, Boston, Greenland.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT COLFAX
dialogues.text: The tandlady didn't _want to say much about hil Only that he's rarely here, that he's very nice, and that he always pays his rent, sometimes months in advance. They come to a room cordoned off and guarded by police.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT COLFAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait 'til you see this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadusky and his team enter the room and stop suddenly at what they see. We REVERSE and find... We're in Ben's apartment, and everything is now all lined in_ plastic. Every square inch of the room. The windows, walls, carpet, television, and all of the furniture. A CHEMISTRY SET sits on the dresser. A box of BLUE ESD BOOTIES sit near the door. The only other thing not cover is a Xerox copied collection of old handwritten letters. Agent Dawes dons a pair of gloves, picks them up, and stu the letters.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT DAWES
dialogues.text: Letters to the editor of The New- England Courant. Written in 1722. She flips through the other letters.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT DAWES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They're all from the same person. (reads a letter) "Your humble servant, Silence Dogood." Agent Hendricks studies the blue booties by the door.  National Treasure, 4/9/03 69.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT HENDRICKS
dialogues.text: What's this guy up to?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT JOHNSON
dialogues.text: Profilers say we're looking at an adult male, a loner, has a high IQ but has never been able to hold down a_ job, is socially inept, has probably written numerous letters— o the White House expressing anti- government sentiments. We're expecting him to contact us shortly with ransom demands. Sadusky eyes the "Don't Tread on Me" Flag which is covere in clear plastic.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: I don't think he's going to be calling with any ransom demands. 234 CUT TO - A BOTTLE OF SAMUEL ADAMS beer is slammed dow a table. We WIDEN to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powell and Shaw sit with Ian who studies the pipe.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Where do you think they went? No response. Ian turns the pipe over, then looks to a cocktail napkin on which he's written the riddle. ON THE NAPKIN, the words "legend" and "key" are underline along with "undetected" and "Silence."

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: That bastard. He did know something he wasn't telling me. Look at this. (points to a line) * "Legend" and "key" are not the same * thing. "Legend" means map. "Key means key.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: The key to the treasure?

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: During the war, generals used secret codes and ciphers to disguise their communications. To decode the cipher, the recipient needed the "key," like a book or an old letter. * "The key in Silence undetected." * You know why Silence is capitalized? Powell and Shaw exchange a look, then hazard a guess...  National Treasure, 4/9/03 70.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Because...it's important?

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Because it's a name.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT 236
dialogues.text: Ben and Abigail look ahead to see a SEA OF POLICE AND FBI in the parking lot of Ben's apartment building.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: What do we do now?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Turn yourselves in.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Go to Hillcrest.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: (scoffs, incredulous) We can't go there!

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: We need the key to the cipher. I had copies. He has the originals.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: He hates you. He'll turn you in.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Whoever it is, he sounds like a good man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oak trees line the street colonial and Queen Anne homes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben knocks on the door and waits with Riley and Abigail. beat, then_a 60-year-old, graying MAN opens the door. He takes one look at Ben, then slams the door. Riley shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I don't think he recognized me.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I think he's still mad at you for not going to Medical School.  238 National Treasure, 4/9/03 71.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (pounds on the door) Dad! Open the door! I need your help. The man opens the door again. We realize now he's PATRICK GATES, Ben's father. He looks to his son, then to Abigail

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Don't tell me. You got her pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: No! Abigail looks down at her stomach, suddenly self consciou

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: (disappointed) I look pregnant?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (to his dad) I need the Silence Dogood letters.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: (incredulous) You have Silence Dogood letters?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Our great great-great -great- randfather George Washington Gates ound a few hidden in an old desk he bought at an auction. No one ever understood their meaning until we found the pipe.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: This better not involve Charlotte.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: My days of looking for Charlotte are over. I swear.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: He's telling the truth, Mr. Gates. Patrick smiles smug as he opens the door to let them in.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: I knew it. I knew there was no Charlotte. I told you so.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Dad, let's not do the "I told you so" thing.  National Treasure, 4/9/03 72.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: I think after all these years I'm entitled to a little "I told you so." I told you, I told your grandpa, I told your_mother. You people wasting your lives chasing something that doesn't exist--

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: --All right, dad, you asked for it. Do you really want to know? I. found. Charlotte. That's right. I really found her. That stops Patrick. He looks to Abigail.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I'm not Charlotte. My name is Abigail. Dr. Abigail Chase.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Charlotte was a ship.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: I know. She left port from Maine 1779. I wasted seven years searching the coast of France.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: She never made it_to France. I found the ship's log of the HMS Erebus, a ship that left port two days before the Charlotte. The captain wrote that his ship barel survived a bad southeaster which figured must have blown the Charlotte off course. That stops Patrick. His eyes flash with excitement.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: How far off course?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ian works on his laptop while Powell and Shaw eat room service food. His computer BEEPS.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: (triumphantly) Silence Dogood. Here she is. ON THE COMPUTER SCREEN are the search results for "Silenc and "Declaration of Independence." We notice the name "SILENCE DOGOOD" many times.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Who is it?  239 240 241 National Treasure, 4/9/03 73.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We PUSH IN on the screen, then PULL OUT and as we hear Ag Johnson's voice take over the explanation...

dialogues.speaker: AGENT JOHNSON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Silence Dogood, a.k.a., Benjamin Franklin. We PULL BACK and realize that we have transitioned to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadusky stands with his team at a make-shift command post The FBI has just run the same Google Search. Agent Johnson reads from his laptop screen.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT JOHNSON
dialogues.text: Ben Franklin was 15 years old, apprenticing for his brother James' newspaper when he secretly wrote 14 letters to the Editor of The Courant using the pen name, Silence Dogood, a middle-aged widowed wife of a Minister. She wrote about colonial life, gained quite a following, and even obtained proposals of marriage. Sadusky regards the copied letters from Ben's apartment.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: These letters were written by Benjamin Franklin? Now, Agent Colfax steps up with a sheet of paper.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT COLFAX
dialogues.text: The gift shop clerk ID'd Gates on the surveillance tapes from earlier in the evening. Sadusky studies Ben's photo. CLOSE ON THE PICTURE, a grainy surveillance image of Ben his tuxedo as he passes through the security checkpoint upon entering the National Archives gala. Sadusky hands the photo back to Agent Colfax.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: Release his picture to the press. Dr. Chase's too. Someone's bound to spot them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben clears the dining room table. Abigail helps, but her eyes search the room and stop on...A PHONE. But it's too close to Ben to get to.  National Treasure, 4/9/03 74.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Where's the bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Down the hall. First door on the right. Abigail disappears into the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abigail moves down the hall and finds to the bathroom. Directly across the hall is a study. Abigail glances back toward the living room, then ducks into the study.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Packed with books on shelves and_in piles. Abigail moves to a desk and finds a phone cradle...but no phone. She notices a collection of FRAMED BUTTONS hanging on the wal CLOSE ON one of the framed buttons. It's a silver-plated George Washington Inaugural button. There is a note, "Dad Found this in a backyard in Maryland. Love, Ben."

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Looking for this? Abigail turns, startled. She sees the phone in Ben's hand

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I thought we had a deal.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: (covers) Dr. Herbert will be worried about me.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You guys dating?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Yes, and he's going to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I figured. He looked like your type.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: You have no idea what my type is.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I know you don't like treasure hunters.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I like men I can trust.  243 244 National Treasure, 4/9/03 75.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ben considers that, then hands her the phone and leaves. Abigail looks at the phone in her hand, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abigail emerges from the hallway with the phone to find B standing there.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Why did you come after me? You had the Declaration of Independence. You could've just gotten away.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Why didn't you call your boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: He's not my boyfriend. They look at each other for a moment, then Riley enters.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I parked the van around back. Ben hands Abigail the gloves. She dons them, then opens the tube. They all look at each other for a beat, then... Abigail carefully slips the Declaration of Independence o of the tube. The document practically glows with history. She catches her breath, mesmerized by its power, then gingerly unrolls the document. They are all awe-struck. Now, Patrick enters with a TRAY OF TEA. He goes to set it on the table, right on the Declaration of Independence... ...but Ben quickly intercepts the tray.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Whoa! Not there. Ben grabs the tray from his dad and sets it on the buffet Now, Patrick notices the ancient parchment on the table.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Where'd you get that? It looks old.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: A little over 200 years.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Wow. You sure? Ben and Riley exchange knowing looks. Riley nods...

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Pretty sure.  244 National Treasure, 4/9/03 76.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Just a map.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: I don't see anything. He reaches to turn the parchment over, but Ben stops him.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: This side. It's invisible ink.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: So, put it in the oven.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: why not? Ferrous sulfate inks can only be brought out with heat.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: But it will damage the--

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: --parchment. (to his dad) She's right. It's very old. We can't risk compromising the map.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: You need a reagent.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I know. Ben grabs a slice of LEMON off the tea tray.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Just the upper right-hand corner.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (peeved) I know.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: If there is indeed a secret message, it will be marked with a symbol there first.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I_know.  National Treasure, 4/9/03 77.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He brushes the lemon over the corner of the parchment. They all eagerly...wait...for it to reveal...anything.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Nothing. Riley looks hard at the parchment, ready to jump off the highest building.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Nothing?

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: You sure it's this side?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: It needs heat. With that, Ben leans in and BREATHES on the parchment. As if by magic, the puff of warm breath reveals... A SERIES OF NUMBERS. They appear briefly, flicker, then disappear. But everyone in the room sees them. A wash of silence overcomes them, then...

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: We need more heat. 245 CUT TO CLOSE ON a hairdryer blowing on a low setting parchment. As it does, a_LONG SERIES OF FADED NUMBERS Slowly emerge: 6.14.7, 4.54.4, 10.1.9...

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Oh. My. God.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: A series of numbers. 3 per set.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: It's an Ottendorf cipher.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: George Washington and the Marquis de Lafayette used them to pass secret messages from the front lines.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: (covering) Duh

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: The first number indicates the page in the key, in this case, the set of Silence Dogood letters. The second number in the cipher is the line on that page . And the third is the word on that line.  National Treasure, 4/9/03

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Where is the map with the "X"?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: There's never a map with an "X."

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Then, who started that legend? Abigail studies the numbers, tears welling in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: This is amazing.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Dad, where're the letters? We need the letters.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: (suddenly guilty) When you left, I got rid of everything. As they talk, Abigail picks up the document and holds it to the chandelier light for closer inspection.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Dad, where are they?!

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: I donated them. Riley hangs his head.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I hope you got a big tax write-off.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Who'd you give them to?

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: There's only one place for them.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You gave them to the Ben Franklin Museum?

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: It completed their collection. 78. Abigail excitedly scrutinizes the writing on the Declarat of Independence.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: This is a tremendous discovery! All this time. No one knew there was something on the back. 245  245 National Treasure, 4/9/03 79.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: On the back of what? Patrick peeks at the front of the document, and his face falls as_he now SEES WHAT'S ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE PARCHMENT. It starts with, "In CONGRESS, July 4th 1776."

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Holy shit!

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: That's the--

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: --I know. Patrick digests that, about to blow a gasket, then...

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: (excited) It's brilliant! | Putting the map on the back of an important document guaranteed the map's survival.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Um, guys... Riley's attention is drawn to the television in the den. On the screen is the grainy surveillance picture of Ben captioned with his name. Ben goes to the television and turns it up.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: ...for questioning in connection with an attempted robbery at the National Archives _ tonight. Authorities are also looking for this woman... ON THE SCREEN, a picture of Abigail also appears. Abigail gasps.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: ...Dr. Abigail Chase, a museum employee who has been reported as missing. Police did not say whether Dr. Chase is a suspect or a witness, only that she is the only National Archives employee not currently accounted for...  245 246 247 National Treasure, 4/9/03 80.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The thought of her being wanted almost makes Abigail fain

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: We should turn ourselves in. We have evidence now.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: The FBI will just think I put those numbers on the back. They'll put me in jail, the Declaration back on display, and Ian will just come after it again.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: He's right. The Declaration of Independence will never be safe.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: So, now what?

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Find that treasure. Ben_looks to his dad surprised . It's first time he's see a glimmer of approval in his dad's face in a long time.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: We need to change our clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A swarm of POLICE CARS and government sedans sit parked o the driveway and street outside Patrick's home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saduskys team sweeps the house. Patrick sits calmly at the table as Sadusky scrutinizes the tea service.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: My son told me to call you. Said_ otherwise I'd be aiding and abetting. Sadusky looks to Agent Dawes who reads from a dossier.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT DAWES
dialogues.text: Benjamin Franklin Gates. Graduated with honors from Dartmouth with a PhD in American History. Spent his summers working on a deep sea salvage expeditions.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: He was looking for Charlotte.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT HENDRICKS
dialogues.text: A girl?  National Treasure, 4/9/03 81.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: (dramatically) A quest. The agents exchange eye-rolling looks, like "another whac

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: Sir, did your son say where he was going?

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: (thinks) No, he never actually said.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: Your son's in a lot of trouble, Mr. Gates. He's stolen a National Treasure.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Sometimes a man has to do something wrong in order to do something right.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: And what would that right thing be? Patrick reaches for something in his pocket and, IN AN INSTANT, every FED (except Sadusky) has their gun out and trained on Patrick who freezes. Sadusky sighs.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Guys. He's going for his wallet. The agents holster their sidearms, and Patrick pulls out his wallet, takes out a $1-bill, and lays it on the table

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Have you ever heard of the Lost Treasure of the Templar Knights?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadusky and his team of agents exit the house. As they walk, Sadusky studies the one-dollar bill.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT JOHNSON
dialogues.text: A_map on the back of the Declaration of Independence? Insanity obviously runs in the family.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT COLFAX
dialogues.text: Let's hope we recover the Declaration before he goes into endgame.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: Whether or not there's a treasure map, Gates isn't the only one after it.  248 249 250 251 252 National Treasure, 4/9/03 82.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Agent Dawes looks to her boss, realizing...

dialogues.speaker: AGENT DAWES
dialogues.text: The gunfire outside the vault room...

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: ...Someone was shooting at Gates. Someone else who knew about the map. Sadusky finally pockets the dollar bill.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ben Gates had copies of the Silence Dogood letters at his apartment. He needed them for something. Let's find out where the originals are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVOLUTIONARY WAR SOLDIERS armed with muskets fire a voll of shots at_a line of RED COATS. BOOM-BOOM-BOOM! Several British fall. We WIDEN to reveal... We're watching a re-enactment of a revolutionary battle. Horses, cannons, drums, gunfire. We MOVE through a CROWD OF TOURISTS which stands on the sidelines and come to... WASHINGTON SQUARE, where a mock-up of a Continental Army encampment has been set up for the show. Standing between the tents, Ben and Abigail survey the scene.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: He's taking too long. He's been caught.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: They're not looking for Riley, just us. He's fine. CUT TO - CLOSE ON a 12-year-old BOY'S FACE pressed agains some glass. We WIDEN to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BOY is looking through exhibit glass at a collection Franklin inventions and artifacts: a glass armonica, a Franklin stove, and many hand-written LETTERS. As the boy studies the letters, we notice some of Sadusky team are here, eyeing the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The museum CURATOR stands with Sadusky and Agent Dawes. H studies a photocopy of Ben Gates drivers license picture.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: We're expecting him to come here--  252 253 254 255 National Treasure, 4/9/03 83.

dialogues.speaker: CURATOR
dialogues.text: --I'm afraid you must be mistaken. The curator hands the photo back to Sadusky.

dialogues.speaker: CURATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Gates Family donated many of the Silence Dogood letters to us. Sadusky and Agent Dawes exchange a curious look.

dialogues.speaker: CURATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fascinating story how they came to have them, in fact. Goes all the way back to President Jackson...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy finally finishes reading the letters and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy exits the museum, passing an ACTOR dressed like BENJAMIN FRANKLIN, spouting aphorisms to PASSERSBY. The boy crosses the cobblestone street and goes to... RILEY. sitting at a_bus stop and working on a Gettysburg Times crossword puzzle. He looks up.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: And.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: You sure? 4th letter, 22nd line--

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: --third word, "and."

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Good. Thanks. Riley hands him $5, then jots down "and" under the number
ON HIS CROSSWORD, we see Riley's written words under the corresponding codes from the Declaration. So far, it read "The trove unfolds for He who tolls pass and..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another line of RED COATS falls to cannon fire...BOOM-BOO The crowd CHEERS, while Abigail grows increasingly anxiou

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I can't take this anymore.  255 National Treasure, 4/9/03 84.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ben watches the re-enactment.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I know. It's all wrong. We lost this battle and every other in Philadelphia... Abigail regards him. That's not what she meant, but he continues on his tangent.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...Most people don't realize that George Washington was a rather poor military tactician, and that it was really Benedict Arnold who won the war for us with his victory in the Battle of Saratoga which finally earned the Continental Army the support of France. Abigail just stares at Ben.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Nothing. I just thought I was_the only one obsessed with meaningless historical trivia.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: There's no such thing. Sometimes... As he talks, Abigail spots something over his shoulder... IAN and SHAW moving through the crowd toward them.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...the littlest things matter the mos-- Without warning, Abigail grabs Ben and...PULLS him IN FOR PASSIONATE KISS. Ben's surprised but goes with it until Abigail just as suddenly pulls out of the kiss.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Ian's here. She motions with her eyes, and Ben follows them to see IA and SHAW pushing through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: He must've figured out what "Silence" meant. Which means he's going to the museum.  255 256 257 258 National Treasure, 4/9/03 85.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ben moves to go, but Abigail grabs him.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I just want you to know that kiss meant nothing. I was only doing it to hide us.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: History remembers what it wants to * remember. With that, Ben and Abigail follow Ian and Shaw. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crowded with TOURISTS. Ian and Shaw move through the thro They come to the corner. Up ahead is the Ben Franklin Museum. In front, there are several FEDERAL AGENTS. Ian stops, looks around, to across the street to where Ri is waiting. Just then, however, a bus pulls up and stops right in fro of Riley, blocking Ian's view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As people climb on and off the bus, Riley stares at somet on the side of the bus. He smiles to himself...

dialogues.speaker: RILEY

Then, a_little more to see the words are inscribed on the Liberty Bell in an ad... ...on_the side of the bus which now pulls away. A beat then Ian steps up with Shaw, but RILEY'S GONE. Ian looks around. See the trash can. On top, the crossword puzzle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadusky and Agent Dawes exit the office. The other agents all signal him with, "Nothing yet." Sadusky notices a WOMAN who looks like a prostitute readi the Dogood letters.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT DAWES
dialogues.text: I don't get it. why would Gates want to steal something the family donated? But Sadus ky isn't pistening. He pulls away from his team to follow the prostitute who is now leaving.  259 260 261 National Treasure, 4/9/03 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prostitute crosses the street to the bus stop, but Riley's long gone. The prostitute looks around.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Who're you looking for? The prostitute sees the suit and immediately looks to run but she's surrounded by the rest of Sadusky's team.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoa, you're not in trouble. We're just looking for the same person you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOLDIERS march to the beat of drums and fife commands. Smoke rises over the field from cannon and musket fire. | Riley moves down a line of Continental Army tents, oblivi to the "melee" in the background.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I'm a genius. I'm a genius! suddenly, someone grabs him and pulls him BETWEEN THE TEN mo Riley a st screams, then sees it's just Ben and Abigail.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Ian's here. *

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter. I got it. "The trove unfolds for he who tolls pass and..." I didn't get the last word, but I figured it ou--

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: --The Liberty Bell.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: How'd you know?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: "Tolls Pass and Stow." It's obvious.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Not that obvious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prostitute sits on the bench, surrounded by FBI.

dialogues.speaker: PROSTITUTE
dialogues.text: All I know is the guy didn't want nothing for his money. Just a word.  National Treasure, 4/9/03 87.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: What word?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soldiers march forward, then stop. An actor playing GEORG WASHINGTON rides a horse, commanding his troops...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE WASHINGTON
dialogues.text: Fire! The soldiers fire synchronized volleys. BOOM-BOOM-BOOM! The British ranks thin. The crowd goes wild.
