dialogues.text: Agent Johnson sits in a parked sedan. Sadusky and the oth wait by the open car door as Agent Johnson works on a lap

dialogues.speaker: AGENT JOHNSON
dialogues.text: 6,903 search hits for the words "stow" and "Declaration of Indepen- dence." The top results being the Fourth of July and the Liberty Bell.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: The Liberty Bell?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT JOHNSON
dialogues.text: Two foundry workers named_John Pass and John Stow cast the bell.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: That's it. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ian and Shaw move through the park.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: You're kidding, right?

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: I wish I were.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: You_mean, we have to ring the Liberty Bell?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crowded with TOURISTS. A TOUR GUIDE stands next to the famous bell (which is enclosed in a glass display case).

dialogues.speaker: TOUR GUIDE
dialogues.text: ...which hasn't been rung in over 150 years. It was in 1846 on George (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 265 266 267 268 National Treasure, 4/9/03 88.

dialogues.speaker: TOUR GUIDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Washington's birthday that the final expansion of the crack occurred, retiring the Liberty Bell permanently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A jong line of TOURISTS snakes across the park plaza. Sadusky and his team move through the crowded plaza.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: I want agents posted in the pavilion and surrounding plaza. As of right now, the Liberty Bell in under around- the-clock guard.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT COLFAX
dialogues.text: What exactly do we think Gates is planning?

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: I don't know, but we already lost one national treasure, I'll be damned if we're going to lose another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the park from the new Liberty Bell Pavilion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM-BOOM-BOOM! A trap door in the belfry floor _is smash open with the butt of the rifle, and Ben, Abigail, and Ri climb up onto the belfry's platform. From here, and Liberty there is a panoramic view of Independence Park Pavilion.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: The Liberty Bell is not here. It's over there.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: But the bell was here when the map was written.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: So, it must be rung from here. Riley considers that, then...

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: OK, then we simulate it. We get the bell's exact size and metallurgic composition and determine the tone it made--  National Treasure, 4/9/03 89.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: --E-flat.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Perfect. We generate a church bell e-flat note digital wave file, we get a couple high excursion, fow- istortion speakers up here, and plug our ears.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: But what could ringing the bell possibly do?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Maybe some stone will magically crumble away, finally revealing the "XxX" that marks the spot. Abigail looks to the street below, swarming with POLICE.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: One thing’s for certain, it'll definitely alert everyone to our presence. Ben looks at her, realizing...

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: The man who rang the Liberty Bell when the Declaration of Independence was signed...who was he?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Andrew McNair. There used to be a plaque commemorating him up here.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Find it. They all three immediately get on their hands and knees a search the old belfry floor. A beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Here it is! Ben hurries to her. Finds an old bronze plaque under laye of dirt. Ben rubs away the dirt with his hand. CLOSE ON the plaque which is dedicated to: "Andrew McNair For tolling the bell on July 8, 1776 Proclaiming the signing of The Declaration of Independence --Member Lodge 43, Lancaster Pennsylvania--"  National Treasure, 4/9/03 90.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ben reads the last line of the plaque.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: "Member Lodge 43" (looks up) McNair was a Freemason. Ben grabs the rifle and pries up the plaque with the bayo

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: "The trove unfolds for he who tolls Pass and Stow." The cipher was talking about McNair. The plaque finally pops off. Underneath...a SMALL HOLE in the floorboards. “Ben looks to them. They both see it.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Jesus... Ben sticks his hand into the hole. A beat, then Ben pulls out his hand. Turns it over. Opens his fist, revealing... PAIR OF OLD BIFOCALS. Riley claps his hands together, happily.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: OK! Super! It's been so worth it. Can we_talk about shares now?  'Cause I really need a PAIR OF GLASSES!

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Bifocals. Abigail studies Ben, realizing...

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Ben Franklin invented them.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: And I'm sure_he's been looking for this pair! Those Founding Fathers and their fraternity pranks! Riley mimics an old man's voice.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "Let's hide old Ben's The map. bifocals!" (feigns laughter) ABIGAIL "HA-HA-HA-HA-HA!" Here. Abigail slips the Declaration out of the musket barrel, a they quickly unroll it as Riley continues his rant.  268 National Treasure, 4/9/03 91.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY BEN
dialogues.text: "And then, because we The trove unfolds... have NOTHING BETTER TO DO, let's put a secret ABIGAIL message on the back of ...means the treasure can the Declaration of be seen... Independence!" Ben dons the bifocals and looks at the Declaration.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well? Ben takes off the glasses. Hands them to Abigail. She slips them on as Riley rattles on.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: "And let's crack the Liberty Bell too!" "Hey, good idea! And FUNNY!" Abigail looks at the Declaration. What she sees takes her breath away. Now, Riley notices the look on her face.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? Abigail stares at the Declaration as if in a trance.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? Abigail stowly looks to Ben in disbelief. He smiles big. Riley looks at them both, impatient...

dialogues.speaker: RILEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? Another riddle? What do we have to do now? T.P. the White House?! Ben takes the glasses off of Abigail's face and hands the to Riley, who puts them on, and we go to his POV. CLOSE ON THE BACK OF THE DECLARATION OF INDEPENDENCE. As the lenses come into view... The blank parchment comes alive! A 3-D image magically appears, rising out 0 @ various shades of parchment c olors, beiges and tans, in a prism, Magic-Eye effect... An 18th CENTURY CHURCH and CEMETERY. An "X" marks a spot in the field of graves. The map is dated "August 17, 1776

dialogues.speaker: RILEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (laughs excited) I knew it! There it is! "X" marks the spot! That's what I've been alking about!  268 269 270 271 272 National Treasure, 4/9/03 92.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ben takes the bifocals from Riley. Studies the map again.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: That's Trinity Church.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: The original Trinity Church burned down just two months after the Declaration of Independence was signed.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I don't think that was a coincidence. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powell exits the pavilion and rejoins Ian and Shaw in the plaza. Right behind them is Independence Hall.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: They're not inside.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: They're here somewhere. Ian looks around, then realizes. He looks up to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abigail rolls up the Declaration and slips it into its co Just then, we hear someone coming up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Someone's coming. BEN looks down from the belfry ust as IAN looks up from the plaza below. THEIR EYES CONNECT.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Ian. Riley pulls open the trap door and sees POWELL sprinting the stairs. Riley slams the trap door shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powell tries to push open the belfry's trap door, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley's standing on the trap door. He yells to Ben...

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Go! Ben and Abigail climb out of the belfry. Riley shoves the musket barrel through an iron ring latch on the trap door  273 274 275 276 277 278 279 280 National Treasure, 4/9/03 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powell shoots up at the trap door...BLAM-BLAM-BLAM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley tap-dances as gunfire chews up the floorboards at h feet. WOOD SPLINTERS and POPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Abigail peer over the edge. It's a 20-foot drop t the roof. Ben looks around for other options. Abigail hands him the Declaration of Independence.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I don't want to be responsible for bending it! With that, she turns and...JUMPS! She LANDS HARD on the rock and tarpaper roof below, then looks up to Ben, who's little awe-struck by her. He tosses the Declaration down to her, then jumps too. CLOSE ON the iron latch as BOOM! Gunfire blows it out. 27

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powell bursts up through the trap door into the belfry, hurries to the edge, and sees Ben and Abigail below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben grabs Abigail and_lunges out of the way as the roof i raked with gunfire. They land hard on a slanted part of the roof. The force knocks the Declaration of Tnuependenc from Abigail's grip. Bullets POCK the shin ges in their wake barely missing th Declaration as it ROLLS...DOWN...THE... INCLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powell chases them with gunfire, when suddenly Riley KIPS DOWN from the outside the belfry' s archway and. KICKS POWELL in the FACE! Powell staggers back, then char Riley, slamming him into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Abigail slide out of control down the incline. Be gets a foothold. Throws out his hand, just catching THE ECLARATION OF INDEPENDENCE inches from the edge.  280 281 282 283 284 National Treasure, 4/9/03 94.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: But Abigail isn't so lucky. She's out of his reach. She tumbles OFF THE LEDGE! She SCREAMS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powell whip-kicks Riley in the chin. He stumbles backward Falls through trap door, grabbing the lip with one hand. Powell scrambles out of the belfry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abigail's fingers grip the rain gutter. A three-story dro below her. Ben scrambles to the edge and peers over. From his vantage point, we have a nice, clear view of... Abigail's cleavage. It's impossible not to notice. And it gives Ben pause. he rain gutter CREAKS, ready to give.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Um, how about a little help? Ben looks back to see POWELL jump down from the clock tow

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: No time. Ben takes the Declaration of Independence...

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hold this. ...And SHOVES it down into Abigail's bosom. She's aghast.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: You can't--

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: --Whatever you do, don't bend it. With that, Ben stands and SLAMS his foot down hard on the rain gutter which TEARS AWAY FROM THE BUILDING! Rivet by rivet, POP-POP-POP! We FOLLOW ABIGAIL as she falls, jerking sharply each time rivet tears away from the plaster. She holds on tight as the rain gutter swings down like a stiff copper vine... TO INDEPENDENCE SQUARE. To her surprise, she lands softly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powell goes to the edge and sees Abigail getting away. He hurries to a roof access ladder, but BEN TACKLES him from behind and pins him to the ground. Just then, we hear ABIGAIL SCREAM! Ben looks down to see Ian and Shaw throw ABIGAIL into a Corvette, then peel out  284 285 286 287 288 289 National Treasure, 4/9/03 95.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ben takes off sprinting, running the length of the roof i the direction of the Corvette. POWELL gets up and takes off running after Ben. RILEY clambers down from the clock tower and joins the ch BEN gets to the end of the roof. There is a gap between fo debate it. en LAUNCHES HIMSELF across’the gap o. "®

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben lands hard, shoulder-rolls to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powell follows suit. He LEAPS across the chasm... ...But lands short, his body slamming against the bricks, then falling to the plaza below. Riley sees him fall, looks away, decides to take the stai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben sprints across the roof. Looks down to see the CORVET in traffic. A TRUCK a few cars behind. Ben FLINGS HIMSELF off the roof...and into a TREE. Lands on a branch. Which instantly BREAKS. Ben tumbles onto...

dialogues.speaker: DAY 288
dialogues.text: The roof of the truck. THUNK!

dialogues.speaker: DAY 289
dialogues.text: Ian drives. Abigail sits stiffly in the front passenger seat, Shaw's gun to the back of her head.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Where's the map?

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: It's called the Declaration of Independence. And it's the reason we kicked your ass in the war. Ian sees the plastic sticking up from Abigail's blouse an reaches for it, but Abigail GRABS HIS WRIST.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Ah-ah-ah! Mustn't wrinkle it. She relents, and Ian slips the document out of her bosom.  289 290 291 292 293 294 295 296 297 National Treasure, 4/9/03 96.

dialogues.speaker: IAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Consider this reparation.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Ben crouches like a_rodeo rider as the truck pulls alongs the Corvette. Ben lunges...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Ben lands on top of the Corvette. ..THUNK!

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Ian and Shaw hear the clatter overhead. Ian pulls a gun from under his seat and FIRES up into the car's roof!

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Ben rolls aside as the car's roof is ripped up by gunfire

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Abigail grabs Ian's arm and struggles with him. Ian can't drive, shoot Ben, and fight her at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Ben barely manages to hang on as the car spins sideways across traffic, then CRASHES into the side of another car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadusky hears, then sees the mayhem in the adjacent stree

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: Get people over there now! Agent Dawes gets on her radio as they all start sprinting toward 5th Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SADUSKY and AGENT DAWES push through panicked TOURISTS, s the Corvette speeding through traffic with Ben clinging t the roof. Is it him? Sadusky calls out...

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: Ben turns. Their eyes meet. Sadusky gets a good look; it's his man. Sadusky pulls out his gun, has a clean shot As the Corvette slaloms traffic, Sadusky follows him with his gun. An easy target. His finger tightens on the trigger...but...he...just...can't...do...it. 289 290 291 292 293 294 295 296 297  297 298 299 300 301 302 National Treasure, 4/9/03 97.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Corvette disappears around a building. Sadusky lowers his gun, mad at himself.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corvette SLAMS over the curb, sending screaming PEOPL ducking and diving out of the way. The Corvette speeds oward... A LINE OF RED COATS. Soldiers scatter, parting like the Red Sea. HORSES buck and BOLT!

dialogues.speaker: DAY 299
dialogues.text: Ian navigates through the battle. Suddenly, Ben reaches i through the open window and grabs the Declaration of Independence from him. Ian fights it, but Abigail BITES HIS ARM! Ian smacks her, then whips the wheel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Sending Ben flying off the top of the Corvette. We FOLLOW BEN who SLAMS onto the grass. Losing the Declaration of Independence which... ...ROLLS AWAY down a grassy hill. Ben gets to his feet, stunned. Realizes he's lost the document which... ...ROLLS into the path of... A GROUP OF OFFICERS ON HORSEBACK. We FOLLOW the DECLARATION as it rolls through the sea of hooves...SLAMMING...DOWN...ALL...AROUND...IT! It finally stops rolling right in front of a BRITISH OFFI ON HORSEBACK who tries to calm his panicked horse. Ben charges into the stampede.

dialogues.speaker: DAY 301
dialogues.text: Ian sees the Ben going for the Declaration of independenc and he GUNS the Corvette right toward Ben and the horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corvette's ENGINE SCREAMS. Ben DIVES one way. The horse rears back the other way, launching the BRITISH OFF skyward.  302 303 304 305 306 National Treasure, 4/9/03 98.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Corvette skids up between Ben and the Declaration of Independence. The driver's side door pops open, and Ian scoops up the Declaration of Independence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ian closes his door and turns back to drive but is greete by Abigail's elbow, which she SLAMS INTO HIS FACE. Ian's nose crunches, spurts blood. Pissed off as all hell Ian reels around with his gun...

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: You little bitc-- He goes to shoot, but just then, the passenger side door pops open, and BEN PULLS ABIGAIL OUT THE OTHER SIDE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Abigail roll away from the Corvette in the grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ian goes to shoot them but is stopped by...

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Forget ‘em. Look! Ian looks through the windshield to see dozens of FEDS sprinting onto the field of battle. Ian GUNS IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corvette peels out. Abigail watches it go.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: He's got the Declaration!

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I know. The British Officer staggers to his feet. Goes to his hor but the horse is... . ..COMMANDEERED by Ben who leaps into his horse's saddle whips it around to find his path is blocked by... SADUSKY AND A LINE OF FEDERAL AGENTS. Guns drawn.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: Freeze, Gates! Ben looks the Corvette which disappears into traffic.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You're letting him get away!  306 307 308 National Treasure, 4/9/03 99.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: Get off the horse, and get on your knees! The FBI AGENTS move in as we PULL UP above the mayhem to. A GOD'S EYE VIEW of the FEDS swarming in on Abigail and B who drops to his knees, defeated as we DISSOLVE TO... CLOSE ON the bifocals which sit_on top of an otherwise ba metal table. We WIDEN to reveal we're in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben sits across from Sadusky, Agents Johnson and Dawes, w finishes the last dregs of her coffee from a styrofoam cu

dialogues.speaker: AGENT DAWES
dialogues.text: They don't look like magic glasses.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: There's nothing magic about it. It's an ancient optical effect. The Egyptians encoded all their major art works with it. It's believed humans used to be able to see the 3D images with the naked eye, but the human eye evolved.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: Evolved?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: In the Bible, the oceans are described as being the "color of wine." That's because the human eye couldn't see the color blue back then. Now, it can. Benjamin Franklin was a genius and inventor. He designed these special lenses and used this optical effect to hide the map on the back of the Declaration of Independence.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: You sure you don't want a lawyer?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Haven't you_ever wondered why all those symbols are on the back of our one-dollar bill? The All-Seeing Eye? The pyramid? Our Foundin Fathers were Freemasons, descendants of the Templar Knights who go all the way back to Ancient Egypt. Sadusky and his team all exchange dubious looks, then...  National Treasure, 4/9/03 100.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: Anyone want more coffee? No takers. Sadusky moves to go, but Ben stops him with...

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You didn't shoot me. Why?

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: On the car. You had a clear bead on me. Why didn't you take it?

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: Because you don't fire into a crowd.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Because you knew there was something else going on here. Sadusky studies Ben. Says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let me get the Declaration back. Ian Howe can't find the treasure without the glasses. I'll cut a deal with him. Tell him I'll give him the treasure if he gives us the Declaration of Independence.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: Why don't you just tell us what the map said, and we'll go make the trade with Mr. Howe?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Ian's too smart for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadusky considers that, nodding his head, then...

dialogues.speaker: AGENT JOHNSON
dialogues.text: You wanna know what I believe? Everyone looks to Agent Johnson.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT JOHNSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That you'd do anything to get your hands on that treasure. That you and Ian Howe made a deal. But once you got close to it, you both got greedy and you each decided you'd et more of the treasure without he other. Am I right? Before Ben can answer, a KNOCK at the door interrupts.  308 National Treasure, 4/9/03 101.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sadusky opens it to find Agents Colfax and Hendricks.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: You find Howe? Colfax and Hendricks exchange a solemn look, then...

dialogues.speaker: AGENT COLFAX
dialogues.text: He just called.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: Great. Where--

dialogues.speaker: AGENT HENDRICKS
dialogues.text: --With his ransom demands. He wants Ben Gates. He's requested that we release him...

dialogues.speaker: AGENT COLFAX
dialogues.text: ...And that no police or federal agents follow him.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: Absolutely not. Out of the question.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT COLFAX
dialogues.text: He said that if we don't comply | with his demands by midnight tonight, e'll... Agent Colfax's voice trails off.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: He'll what?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT HENDRICKS
dialogues.text: He'll... (chokes out the words) ...cut off a piece of the Declaration of Independence every hour and send it to us in a box. The agents are all horrified by the prospect.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: He's not bluffing. Agent Johnson loses it and charges Ben, grabbing him by t collar and throwing him up against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT JOHNSON
dialogues.text: You little prick. How do we know that you and Howe didn't plan this whole’ thing?!

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You don't.  National Treasure, 4/9/03 102.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Agent Johnson stares daggers at Ben who looks to Sadusky.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I'm all you got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadusky escorts a handcuffed Ben toward a glass walled conference room. Inside, agents huddle around Agent Hendricks who talks on the phone. Hendricks sees Sadusky and pokes his head out of the room

dialogues.speaker: AGENT HENDRICKS
dialogues.text: It's Howe! He wants to talk to Gates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wearing handcuffs, Ben takes the phone from Agent Hendric

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Hello, Ian. A long beat as Ben listens. A digital recorder records th conversation in the background while Agent Colfax monitor it on headphones. Finally....

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yes, I understand. With that, he hangs up and looks to Sadusky.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: USS Intrepid. Port side. East River. He's coming in by chopper.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: New York?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: In three hours.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT DAWES
dialogues.text: We'd better hurry.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT JOHNSON
dialogues.text: He say anything else?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: No feds. No wires. Or no deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Islands crammed with high rises.  312 313 314 315 316 317 318 319 National Treasure, 4/9/03 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Retired combat aircraft sit idle on the deck. Flags and pennants flap in the breeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A high-tech van sits in the parking lot. Several antennas protrude from the van's roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This surveillance vehicle is packed with equipment. Shirt off, Ben is wired by Sadusky's team while Sadusky watches Sitting at a computer bay, Agent Colfax wears headphones.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT COLFAX
dialogues.text: Say something.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Can I put my shirt back on?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT COLFAX
dialogues.text: All right. He's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben climbs out of the van. Turns back.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I need the bifocals. Agent Dawes gives them to him, and Ben pockets them.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: As soon as he shows you the Declaration, we'll move in. Don't try anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hidden here _is an FBI SNIPER. Through his scope, we FOLL Ben as he climbs the gangway and steps onto the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the street, more FEDS watch and wait. Agent Hendri searches the skies with binoculars for the chopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben crosses the deck to the port side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, Agent Hendricks sees something in the distance.  319 320 321 322 323 324 325 326 National Treasure, 4/9/03

dialogues.speaker: AGENT HENDRICKS
dialogues.text: I got a visual. We see it now. A TINY SPECK in the sky. A chopper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadusky sits with Agents Dawes and Colfax.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT DAWES
dialogues.text: Think it's Howe? Sadusky leans into a microphone.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: Get ready, Gates.
319 320 321 Ben moves to the edge of the deck. Nothing but river belo He checks his watch, then...

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (into his mic) Sadusky? INTERCUT Sadusky in the van.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: (into his mic) Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (VIA MIC)
dialogues.text: I want you to know that Abigail had nothing to do with this. I know you believe me. INTERCUT Sadusky and Dawes, exchanging worried looks.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT DAWES
dialogues.text: What the hell is he talking about?!

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: Shit! He set us up! INTERCUT BEN on the deck. He JUMPS! A 60-foot drop... SPLASH! Ben knifes into the East River.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a_loud POP! As the wires on Ben's body short out. Agent Colfax whips off his headset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calling orders into a radio, Sadusky and Dawes jump out o the van and sprint across the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: Gates jumped! He's in the river! Move in! Move in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FBI SNIPER scrambles, searches the water below, can't see shit. The flight deck blocks his view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben surfaces a few feet from the hull. A beat, then BUBBL appear next to him and... A _DIVER'S HEAD pops out of the water. The diver slips ba his mask...it's RILEY.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Ransom demand? Riley grins, affects a British accent.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I rather liked that part too. He hands Ben a TANK, REGULATOR, and set of FINS. Grins.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Just like diving for that wreck off the coast of France. Ben jams the regulator into his mouth, and they disappear from the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FEDS lean over the flight deck, searching the murky water

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More FEDS scour the shore. No sign of Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadusky moves purposefully down a line of holding cells, stops at one. Inside, sits Abigail.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: We know you're not involved. You're free to go. Abigail looks at him, surprised.  333 334 National Treasure, 4/9/03 106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the corner of Wall Street and Broadway, this medieval gothic church is dwarfed by modern skyscrapers all around

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We FOLLOW a man's legs, walking up the aisle. He stops a pew. Sits. We WIDEN to reveal that it's IAN.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You're late. We WIDEN MORE to reveal BEN in the pew in front of Ian.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: I took a look around. Waited. Made sure you weren't working with the FBI.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Satisfied?

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Not until I get that treasure.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Do you have the Declaration of Independence?

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: If I give it to you now, how do I know you won't just walk off with it and forget about the treasure?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: How do I know you'll give me the Declaration of Independence after I show you where the treasure is?

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: I guess we're just going to have to trust each other.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: That's easy for you to say. I never tried to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Come on, Ben. This is a treasure hunt. It's just the way it is. I actually quite like you. If we weren't such enemies, I do believe we'd be great friends.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Forget it, Ian. Deal's off.  National Treasure, 4/9/03 107.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ben stands and starts down the aisle. Ian calls after him

dialogues.speaker: TAN
dialogues.text: All right! Ian pulls out his cell phone. Punches in a number.

dialogues.speaker: IAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Bring it.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I want the pipe too.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: What pipe?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: The Meerschaum pipe. From the Charlotte. I found it. You took it. Ian rolls his eyes, then talks into the phone...

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: And bring the bloody pipe. With that, Ian hangs up. A beat, then the church doors. open, and SHAW enters with Declaration of Independence in mailing tube. Shaw approaches and hands Ben the tube. He opens it, verifies that the Declaration of Independence is inside, then hands it back. Ben then reaches into his pocket and pulls out THE BIFOCA Ian regards them, realizing...

dialogues.speaker: IAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The All Seeing Eye.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (excitedly) We found them in the Independence Hall belfry. There really is a map on the back of the Declaration of Independence. It's the most fantastic thing you'll ever see! Ian is caught up in the moment. He reaches for the bifoca but Ben "accidentally" drops them. We watch as THE BIFOCALS FALL TO THE FLOOR IN SLO-MO and then land on the tiled floor...CRACK! And if that isn't bad enough, Ben finishes them off by

dialogues.speaker: STOMPING ON THEM WITH HIS SHOE. ..CRUNCH
dialogues.text: 334 335 336 National Treasure, 4/9/03 108.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The bifocals lie on the floor in a million crystal pieces

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoops! I guess you'll just have to take my word for it. Enraged, Ian lunges at Ben and tackles him to the church floor. PARISHIONERS crane their necks to see the commotio Ian pins Ben and shoves a gun into Ben's stomach.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: I'll kill you for that!

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You do, and the secret to the treasure dies with me. Ian stares at Ben. Knows he's not bluffing.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I give you the treasure; you give me the Declaration of Independence.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: That's it?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: That's it. Ian stands, then holds out his hand for Ben.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: I guess that makes us partners again. Ben ignores him. Gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. And no guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The REVEREND enters the foyer just as Ben, Ian, and Shaw exit. The Reverend moves to the collection dish and finds ..Two GUNS. He looks around, where did these come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben, Ian, and Shaw exit the church, passing AN OLD LADY I A BLACK SHAWL who reaches out and GRABS BEN'S WRIST! Startled, Ben looks to the woman, realizes it's...ABIGAIL She pushes back her shroud.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: What're you doing here?!  336 337 338 National Treasure, 4/9/03

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I saw the map, remember? Ben and Ian exchange a knowing look.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Bloody hell!

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Don't worry. Nobody followed me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadusky, Agent Dawes, and Agent Johnson_enter. Agents Hendricks and Colfax’ stand outside the ladies res room, tails between their legs.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT COLFAX
dialogues.text: She asked to go to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT HENDRICKS
dialogues.text: She was only in there for 30 seconds. I swear. Sadusky looks around, moving forward.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: All right. Both Gates and Dr. Chase came here, to Manhattan. What for?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT JOHNSON
dialogues.text: The treasure.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT HENDRICKS
dialogues.text: There's no way_any treasure's still buried here. “Everything's changed, ground's been dug up for Subways and underground parking lots, high rises.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: So what in Manhattan hasn't changed in over 200 years?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worn tombstones and crypts going all the way back to the 17th century are enclosed in this ancient chu old wrought iron fence. Ben, Abigail, Ian, and Shaw come around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Normally I find graveyards rather depressing, but in this case, I find it uplifting and full of promise. Where do we start? rchyard by an 109. 336 337 338  National Treasure, 4/9/03 110.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Riley approaches, carrying a shovel.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Uh, bad news. There's no "X."

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Yes, there is.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I've looked all over.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You're not looking right.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Problem, partner?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: No. Ben and Abigail look around. Then, Ben looks to the sky.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In the maps there was a crescent e moon int sky.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Maybe the "X" can only be seen at night. Realizing, Ben starts walking back toward the church. Ril calls after him.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Well, it's night now, and I don't see it! With that, Ben pulls open the heavy church doors, and... LIGHT SPILLS OUT OF THE CHAPEL, cutting a swath through t graveyard, casting EERIE TOMBSTONE SHADOWS everywhere. None of which look like an "X." Except maybe... Ben_moves to where the shadow of a plant is cast onto the wall of A LONG STONE CRYPT. Ben backtracks, following the source of the shadow to... A GRAVESTONE. Covered in ivy. As Ben starts pulling away the ivy, Ian and the others approach. Ben clears the ivy, revealing the gravestone. We see now that a TEMPLAR CROSS has been hewn out of the ancient sto They all exchange knowing looks.  National Treasure, 4/9/03 111.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "XxX" marks the spot.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Here? Under this grave? Ian grabs Riley's shovel, goes to start digging, but Ben stops him with...

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: No. Ben points across the cemetery.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There. They all follow his finger and finally see it. The "X" in the gravestone casts a giant shadow of an "X" on the side of the stone crypt. Ben smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "XxX" marks the spot. He moves to_ the crypt. The shadow falls in the direct center. Riley laughs excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Can you believe that?

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: I will when I see the treasure. Ben kneels beside the worn crypt Feels carefully along the surface as if reading Braille. He stops. Digs out some soft dirt, revealing what looks to be... A SMALL KEYHOLE.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Ian, give me the pipe. Shaw digs the pipe out of his pocket and hands it to Ben. Abigail eyes the pipe.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: tty God, that's an amazing piece! What craftsmanship!

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I know. That's why I hate this part.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: What part? Ben SLAMS the pipe against the stone. It SHATTERS, reveal a THIN SKELETO EY that was hidden inside.  338 339 340 341 National Treasure, 4/9/03 112.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ben scoops up the key and slips it into the key hole. A perfect fit. He looks to the others who all stand by anxiously, then TURNS THE KEY. Suddenly, there is a loud SCRAPING SOUND as a two-foot_ t section of the crypt's lid SLIDES OPEN on a ancient pulle system. As it opens we can see... A NARROW PASSAGE. Barely wide enough for one person to squeeze through. A very dark. They all exchange a look. And can't help but smile at the sudden success. Ian looks to Riley.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: You first.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: No way. The guy who goes first always gets killed.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: That's silly.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Hey, I don't make the rules. There's always a map with an "X," and there's always a trap. Maps and traps. That's just what guys who hide treasures do.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I'll go first. Ben flicks on a flashlight and ducks down inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old moss covered steps descend at a steep angle into darkness. Ben waves his flashlight around. The passageway below takes a sharp turn. He calls up to the others.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Looks OK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley steps down next, but dust then, the lid begins to RUMBLE CLOSED! Ian pushes Abigail harshly aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben hears the rumbling, looks back, sees Ian and Shaw com down the stairs, pushing by Riley.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Where's Abigail?!  National Treasure, 4/9/03 113.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ben pushes by them and charges back to the stairs to see that the crypt entrance is CLOSING...CLOSING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abigail looks to the crypt . It's almost closed. She scrambles to her feet, lunges for the crypt, and... TUMBLES through the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and ROLLS RIGHT INTO Ben's arms just as the crypt door seals behind her, inches from crushing her. Ben holds her their faces almost touching. The chemistry...electric.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: How'd I know if I hung out with you jong enough, I'd eventually be robbing graves? Ben grins, cocky. Just then, Riley pokes his head into th stairwell, carrying a lantern.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: You guys coming down the creepy stairway or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben, Abigail, and Riley join Ian and Shaw, and they move down this long, stone-walled tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: I know you all think I'm the "bad guy but were it not for me making he hard choices, we wouldn't be here’ now, would we?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: If you don't want to be the "bad guy," Ian, all you have to do is give me the Declaration of Independence.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Even if I gave it to you, you wouldn't leave. You're too close.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Try me. Ian studies Ben for a beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Sorry. I need you to find the treasure.  National Treasure, 4/9/03 114.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Abigail holds her lantern up to the walls which are intermittently coffered with lions' heads, solar-crosses, and snakes. She looks to Ben who explains...

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Masonic symbols.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: What do they mean?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: That we're getting close.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: But watch out for the trap. Because it's coming up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben, Abigail, Riley, Ian, and Shaw_enter this dark, dank dirt-walled room. They shine the lights about, but there' nothing here.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Dead end. Suddenly, a SKELETON'S TORSO falls out of the ceiling, ri in front of Riley's face. He SCREAMS! Ben shines his flashlight upwards to see... HUNDREDS OF GRINNING SKULLS, half buried in the dirt ceil peering down at them. The remnants of uniforms, boots, an rass buttons can be seen.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Hessians. (off Riley's look) German soldiers who fought for the British during the Revolution. They were buried in a common grave. Shaw looks up. Just above him, there is a gun and flintlo powder horn in a dead soldier's belt.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: There must be another outlet. Something we missed. Come on. They all turn to go, but Shaw hangs back. He reaches up t the gun and tries to take it, but it's stuck. As Shaw yanks harder, bits of dirt and dust rain down on him. Suddenly... A BAYONETED RIFLE SWINGS out of the ceiling like a pendul attached to a skeleton's arm, and...  345 346 347 National Treasure, 4/9/03 115.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ...STABS SHAW in the chest! The group turns and sees Shaw as he staggers back with th rifle stuck in his chest. Ben goes to help him, but Shaw crashes into... The dirt wall behind him which caves in under his weight. Shaw falls through the hole in e wall, screaming a he way down. Which sounds like a long way down. The group rushes to the hole in the wall and shine their lights into it, revealing... A DEEP, NARROW SHAFT in the wall. In the shaft, there han two heavy chains with weights attached.

dialogues.speaker: IAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: well, that was fortunate, now wasn't 1t? Ben reaches into the shaft and adjusts the weights on the chains. The chains CREAK as an ancient WOODEN BOX descend into view from higher in the shaft. Ben and Abigail exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: It looks like an elevator. Ben and Riley pry open the door on the box, and a MILLION RATS and COCKROACHES pour out from the elevator cab! They all gulp, staring at the vermin. A beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I hate elevators. Ben steps inside. The elevator CREAKS and GROANS but hold

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Come on. They all step in. MORE CREAKING. Ben adjusts the weights again and the cab descends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadusky's team sweep the church and surrounding grounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadusky is here, kneeting in the dirt next to the crypt. He picks up a piece of the broken Meerschaum pipe and examines them. Agent Dawes approaches.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT DAWES
dialogues.text: Got a positive ID from the Reverend. They were here.  National Treasure, 4/9/03 116.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: But Sadusky isn't jistening. He looks to the crypt and notices that the edges of the stone have recently been disturbed. The ivy overgrowth has also been torn away.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT DAWES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is it? Sadusky tries to lift the crypt's stone lid to no avail.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT DAWES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There's no moving that. It's got to weigh a ton. Sadusky looks at Agent Dawes and realizes she's right.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: I want sonar here on the double. And bring in a jackhammer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes look around, warily as the cab descends creakily into depths unknown. Deeper...deeper still...

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I just want to point our that there are no buttons on the panel. In fact, there is no panel. How's this thing going to take us back up?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: It's a one-way elevator.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Then, it's not an elevator, is it? Because it doesn't elevate. Suddenly, the cab STOPS. They've hit something. WATER rushes in at their feet, filling the cab up to their ankl Riley and Ian pull open the wooden elevator door, and mor water RUSHES IN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shine their lights into the room. The chamber is circular, and there is a STONE PLATFORM in the center. | Three 14th Century SWORDS jut out of the stone platform i a crisscross formation.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Templar Swords. Ian moves to the platform, followed by Ben and Abigail. Riley slogs out last. He steps something which CRUNCHES under his foot. Riley looks down to find...  349 National Treasure, 4/9/03 117.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I knew it. (sing-song) It's a trap. Riley starts searching the walls for a way out while Ian, Ben, and Abigail study the swords.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: What do they mean? Ian reaches for one of the swords.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Ian, I wouldn't-- But Ian does anyway He pulls out the center sword. We immediately hear the RUSHING SOUND OF WATER. Everyone loo around. The sound is all around them.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: What's that? But Ian doesn't care. He just studies the sword. Riley continues feeling the walls but can find no exit.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How're we supposed to get out of here?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Look at this. Ben shines his Rient on_ the side of the platform to see bas relief a SNAKE CUT INTO PIECES carved into the stone. Abigail immediately recognizes the severed snake symbol.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: "Join or die."

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I say we join. Ben kneels down to study a STONE SLOT in a CIRCULAR STONE at a vertex of a triangle etched into the floor.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: When we were at war with France, Ben Franklin drew a political cartoon of a snake cut into eight pieces, representing the eight colonies at the time. he cartoon called the colonies to "Join or Die."  349 National Treasure, 4/9/03 118.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The sound of the rushing water intensifies as Ben notices two more slots in the floor at the triangle's other verti

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: But what does that mean? Now, the sound of the RUSHING WATER builds to a CRESCENDO and suddenly, WATER VOMITS into the chamber from several ancient drains in the walls near the ceiling. The force of the thundering cascade knocks all of them of their feet, Ian drops his sword, but more importantly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water also pours into the chamber from the elevator shaft Before anyone can react, the chamber is already filled up to their chests. Abigail and Ben both see the Declaration of Independence its tube bobbing around in the churning water. Ben frantically swims to it, but it slips away...just out of his reach.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: I got it! The tube floats to Abigail. She scoops it out of the wate then holds it over her head as the water swirls around he The chamber is filling quickly and it's now mostly dark except for the faint glow of he submerged flashlights. Everyone claws at the walls, finding no purchase in the smooth stone. Ben calls over the din of the rushing water

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Listen! We have to work together! "Join or die."

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: How? !

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: There is a triangle carved into the floor! At each vertex, there isa slot! We must get the swords, then each of us must stick them in the slots and turn the swords! All of us, together! Riley regards Ben for a long beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Are you out of your mind?! Ben answers by disappearing under the water's surface.  349 350 351 352 353 354 355 356 357 358 National Treasure, 4/9/03 119.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Riley and Abigail exchange a_look. Then, Riley looks up. The flat stone ceiling is only a few feet overhead now. qhey oii soon be drowned. Riley takes a deep breath, then ives own. UNDERWATER. Ben dives down to the platform. The two remaining SWORDS are still sticking up out of it. He grab one. Ri ey swims up behind him and grabs the other. hey both then kick back toward the surface. IN THE CHAMBER. Ben and Riley resurface with the swords, gasping for breath. Ben hands Ian the sword.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Find the slot! At the triangle's vertex. The stone walls suddenly GROAN under the tons of pressure

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go! All three disappear underwater, leaving Abigail, holding the Declaration up high, but the water is rising rapidly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WORKERS finally jackhammer through the crypt wall, and Sadusky peers inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abigail still holds the Declaration of Independence above her head, but there is less than a foot of space left now UNDERWATER. Riley and Ian dive down, feel the floor, find edges of the triangle, and follow them. BEN also feels th floor, searching for the sword... IN THE CHAMBER. Only inches of space left now. Abigail presses the Declaration of Independence and her face against the ceiling in the cramped pocket of air. UNDERWATER. Ian follows his edge. Finds the vertex slot. Shoves his sword into it. Turns it. RILEY finds his vertex and does the same. BEN finally finds the sword. IN THE CHAMBER. Abigail and the Declaration of Independence are now completely submerged. There is no ai pocket anymore. UNDERWATER. Ben finds the third vertex, plunges the sword into the slot and... .».TURNS IT. 349 350 351 352 353 354 355 356 357 358  359 360 361 362 National Treasure, 4/9/03 120. ON ABIGAIL. Suddenly, the chamber ceiling RUMBLES as the heavy stone ceiling slabs START SLIDING APART! CUT TO - PITCH BACK. We hear the SCRAPING SOUND of the 36 stone floor rolling open. As it does, the faintest_ glimm of light peeks up from the submerged flashlights below. A beat, then Abigail's hand POKES UP THROUGH THE CRACK in the floor, holding the Declaration of Independence. She tosses it aside onto the dry floor, then pulls hersel up through the opening. Ian pulls himself up through the floor next, then rolls aside, gasping for air in a soggy heap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadusky and his team sprint down the passageway and come thes rave room. Only now, the elevator shaft is COMPLETEL The elevator chains disappear into a pool of water which spills into the ossuary.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: There's got to be another way down. Find it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water gurgles up through the widening crack in the fl Abigail waits by it. A beat, then Riley surfaces, coughin

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Where's Ben? Ian catches his breath, then peers into the darkness. In the near distance, we can see something...GLIMMERING. Suddenly, the floor starts rumbling closed again. Panicke Abigail calls out...

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ben! Ben! Ian picks up the Declaration of Independence which lies o the stone floor near him. Just then, Ben comes up gasping for air, choking on swallowed water, but...holding a flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (between coughs) I thought we might need this. The flashlight beam cuts through the darkness. We catch glimpses of pillars, statues, stone steps...  362 National Treasure, 4/9/03 121.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Is that...? The beam of light stops on something very shiny... It's a three-tiered bronze-gilded altar. The very sight of it makes Abigail gasp. Ian stares at it, mesmerized...

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: ".,.An altar of bronze, twenty cubits long and twenty cubits wide..." Second Book of Chronicles. Ian and Ben exchange knowing looks.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Stolen from the Temple of Solomon in the 5th Century B.C. The group moves to the altar where they find candles and torches. They quickly light them, then turn to see... THE TREASURE CHAMBER. Dozens of marble Doric and Corinthian columns line the wa of the cavernous chamber filled with ancient treasures... Crown jewels, gold and silver plates and chalices, gilded cherubim, olivewood furniture, carriages, loot from the Oracle of Delphi, and countless sacred artifacts.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: This is what it must have been like to find King Tut's Tomb.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Don't say that. Those guys were cursed. Ian starts moving through the chamber, in awe of its treasures. But Ben doesn't move. He just stands there.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: We'll be taking the Declaration of Independence now, Ian. Ian finds a chest, opens it...it's filled with ancient Gr and Roman coins.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Oh come on, Ben. Have some fun. Ian moves past the chest, and Riley can't help himself. H oes to it, sticks his hand in it, and comes up with a andful of coins. He laughs, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: A deal's a deal, Ian.  National Treasure, 4/9/03 122.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: But Ian isn't listening. He's found another ANCIENT SWORD only this one is different...special. Its silver handle is decorated with images of scythed | chariots engaged in battle and the famous Macedonian King Riley steps up behind Ian. He sees the sword.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Cool gothic sword.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: It's not just any sword... Ian picks it up. It's heavy. Weighs more than 30 pounds.

dialogues.speaker: IAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...It's the sword of Alexander the Great... As Ian holds up_the sword, we notice that it almost GLIST with an ethereal power.

dialogues.speaker: IAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...It was used to conquer the world. Without warning, Ian swings the sword backwards under his arm in a rowing motion and... ...Plunges it into RILEY'S STOMACH! Riley staggers back, stunned. Then, he collapses. Shocked and horrified, Ben and Abigail rush to Riley. He' bleeding. Badly.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Riley. Oh, Jesus... Ben takes off his shirt. Balls it up. Presses it on Riley wound. Abigail helps Ben hold it there. Riley looks up to Ben. He knows it's bad. He grimaces in agony.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: At least I was rich before I died. With that, Ian swings his_sword at Ben who just barely ro out of the way it time. The sword hits the stone floor with a loud CLANK, taking out divot of stone.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: You couldn't just want the treasure now, could you, Ben? Ian swings again, but Ben grabs a bronze plate and blocks the blow. SPARKS fly as the plate shatters.  National Treasure, 4/9/03 123.

dialogues.speaker: IAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You couldn't just be reasonable and argue with me over shares. I say, "How about 70-30?" And then you say, "How about 60-40?" And then I say, "What about 80-20?" Ben scrambles to his feet, and Ian chases him.

dialogues.speaker: IAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, you have to go and be all noble. He swings the sword at Ben again, but Ben dives behind a suit of armor which Ian SMASHES with his sword. Ben goes down with the medieval suit which clatters to th ground. Ben shoulder-rolls to his feet and comes up with sword of his own. They face off. En Guard! They circle each other.

dialogues.speaker: IAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don't trust honest men. Ian strikes. Ben parries. Their swords cross with a loud CLANK. They push off each other, and then the duel begins in earnest. Actually, it's more like two guys fighting a bar fight wi heavy swords. Neither is trained in fencing, but neither is about to give up first. They exchange blows in an exhausting Rob Roy-esque_ sword tig t. Ian attacks. Ben parries and simultaneously delive a brutal kick to Ian's ribs, staggering Ian. The Declaration of Independence falls to the ground and rolls away, down some stone steps... Angered, Ian winds up. Strikes a vicious blow. Ben deflec it with his sword which breaks in half. The other half clanks to the ground. ON ABIGAIL. She's applying pressure to Riley's wound. She sees the Declaration of Independence rolling toward a sla drain in the floor... She_grabs Riley's hands and puts them on the now bloody, balled up shirt.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Apply pressure. Riley weakly holds onto the field dressing as... Abigail hurries to the still rolling Declaration of Independence which is almost to the drain.  362 National Treasure, 4/9/03 124.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Abigail DIVES FOR_IT...but just misses it. The Declaratio of Independence slips through the slats and DISAPPEARS DO

dialogues.speaker: THE DRAIN
dialogues.text: ON IAN and BEN. Ian swings. _ Ben ducks and dodges, but Ian's sword catches pieces of him. Slices into Ben's shoulder. And his chest. ON ABIGAIL. She sticks her hand into the drain... INSIDE THE DRAIN. The Declaration of Independence is stuc way down deep in the drain where the drain narrows. Abigail's hand reaches down for the tube, but it's...just out...of...reach. ON BEN and IAN. Bloodied, Ben hurls the broken sword at Ian who deflects it and charges Ben. Ben scrambles over the treasure pile, improvising, grabbi whatever he can to parry Ian's blows. A chalice...CLANK! An urn...which shatters! Ben grabs an alabaster cherubim. He holds it up to deflec a blow, but notices that it's just too beautiful to ruin. Ben sets it back down, then dives behind a PILLAR just as Ian swings again, striking the pillar instead...WHAM! Chu of marble fly. Ian circles around the pillar, chasing the wounded Ben wi his sword. Ian swings, and Ben ducks. This time, Ian's sword gets STUCK in the pillar. As Ian tries to extricate it... Ben pushes a Greek limestone statue. But it's heavy. It teeters...finally tips. Ian turns Aust in time to see the statue about to crush him. CRASH! But it doesn't crush Ian. The statue instead crashes into the pillar, leaving just enough space to save Ian. Ian grabs the sword, yanks it out... Bad idea. The pillar gives way, and the statue finishes its fall, smashing down on Ian. Killing him instantly. And tearing a hole in the stone wall behind him. Water GUSHES IN from the hole. It's the elevator shaft. As the water rushes in, the whole treasure chamber begins to rumble. Pieces of the stone ceiling start to fall, crashing down all around. Ben looks to see Abigail still struggling with the drain.  362 363 364 National Treasure, 4/9/03 125.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ON ABIGAIL. She's got her whole arm in the drain but she still can't reach the Declaration of Independence. Rocks and debris rains down all around her.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Look out! Abigail pulls her hand out of the drain. Turns to see Ben hol ing the Sword of Alexander up high. He swings it down SMASHING the drain open. Abigail quickly reaches in and pulls out the Declaration Independence. They hurry to Riley. Everything is shaking, falling apart

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: (weakly) The treasure room's caving in.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: We know.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: That always happens. Ben and Abigail grab Riley under his arms_and help him to the pillar that's crashed through the wall. The water has leveled off in the shaft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Abigail peer into the shaft. The two chains disappear into the water below.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: We have to get in the water.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: (to Riley) Can you swim?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Do I have a choice? As everything in the treasure chamber collapses behind th Ben pushes Riley into the water and jumps in after him. * Abigail follows, then Ben swings the sword and cuts one o the chains. The elevator shoots out of the depths, catchi Ben, Abigail and Riley and carrying them up the shaft!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three roll off the roof of the charging elevator and spill out onto the ossuary floor as the elevator disappea up into the shaft with the sword. *  364 365 366 National Treasure, 4/9/03 126.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Abigail lands on Ben. They regard each other. Surprised to be alive. Dust and debris settle in the room. Riley lies in the dirt, staring up at the hundreds of grinning skulls looking down on him.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Are we dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadusky, his team, and dozens of POLICE are here.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, can we get a little help over here? Sadusky turns to see Ben and Abigail helping Riley out_of the crypt stairwell. In an instant, a swarm of federal agents and police are on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadusky hands the Declaration of Independence over to an armored transport, which pulls away with an escort of a dozen police cars. Sadusky's team, Ben, and Abigail stand nearby with two EM who load Riley onto an ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: EMT
dialogues.text: (to Ben) He lost a lot of blood, but he's going to be fine. Now, Sadusky approaches.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: OK, guys let's go. The federal agents all start to leave. Ben and Abigail look at each other, confused.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Aren't you going to arrest us?

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: What for? You do something wrong? Ben and Abigail exchange a look like, no...okay...go...by Sadusky grins at them, then heads to his sedan.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You kids need a ride? Ben and Abigail smile at each other. 364 365 366  366 367

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: National Treasure, 4/9/03 127.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: No thanks. We'll walk.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: All right. Good night! CLOSE ON Sadusky's hand as he climbs into his car. On his finger, we now See that he wears a SILVER MASONIC RING, just like the one Charles Carro an oun ulaski wore. As Sadusky drives away, Ben and Abigail look back to the Trinity Church graveyard.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Too bad no one will ever know.

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: We'll know. With that, she kisses Ben. A long, deep kiss. Then, suddenly, Ben pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Just tell me one thing. Does this kiss mean anything? Abigail considers that, then...

dialogues.speaker: ABIGAIL
dialogues.text: Only time will tell. With that, they kiss some more as_we PULL BACK as the fed agents ali get in their cars and leave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben, Abigail, Riley (all better now), Ben's dad Patrick, Sadusky, his whole team, Dr. Herbert, Woodruff, and all t National Archives GUARDS stand proud, watching as... THE DECLARATION OF INDEPENDENCE is raised back up in its display case to its wall exhibit. Dr. Herbert crosses himself. Thank God. Woodruff sheds a tear. Ben, Abigail, and Riley exchange cocky smiles. Dr. Herbert checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HERBERT
dialogues.text: Opening time. And with that, the "ceremony" is over. Everybody scatters back to their regular routine. Woodruff takes one more look at the precious document, then shrugs...

dialogues.speaker: WOODRUFF
dialogues.text: No one will ever know. 366
368 National Treasure, 4/9/03 128.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GUARDS open the front doors, and museum PATRONS and TOURISTS start filing in. Ben and Riley cross the traffic and head down the front steps. It's another beautiful day on Pennsylvania Avenue. Riley takes it all in...and then sighs.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: So, any other family quests, treasures that you might know about, something else can waste seven years of my life with?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Nope. That was the only one.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Gates! Poole! They turn to find the Sadusky and his team approaching.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: What now?

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: It seems that, well, the President's been looking for uh, something else fora very tong time, and he would very much appreciate your help in finding it. Ben and Riley look at each other and GRIN BIG as we start SLOWLY PULLING UP for a overhead view of the National Archives...

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I don't know, Sadusky . How much he paying? "Cause the last expedition went on was sort of a bust.

dialogues.speaker: SADUSKY
dialogues.text: How much do you want? As they talk, we continue PULLING UP until we have a glorious, sky-high, panoramic view of our great nation's Capital, and we.. FADE OUT. The End.
